extraExplanation: “recharge”原意常用于电池/设备充电（recharge a battery/phone）。在日常英语里也很常用作比喻，表示通过睡眠、休息、散步、旅行或远离压力来“给自己充电”。
常见搭配：recharge your phone/battery；recharge after work；feel (completely) recharged；take time to recharge。

summary.en: A recharger is a device used to recharge batteries (often called a charger).
summary.zh: recharger 指用于给电池或设备充电的装置（更常说 charger）。

definition.en: a device used to recharge a battery or power a device (a charger)
definition.zh: 给电池或设备充电的装置；充电器

examples.en: I forgot my phone recharger at home.
examples.zh: 我把手机充电器忘在家里了。

examples.en: This recharger works with USB-C cables.
examples.zh: 这个充电器适用于 USB-C 线。

definition.en: a person or thing that recharges something (less common in everyday English)
definition.zh: 给某物补充能量的人或事物（日常英语中较少用）

examples.en: After the hike, a good meal was my recharger.
examples.zh: 徒步之后，一顿好饭就是我的“能量补给”。

extraExplanation: “recharger”在英语里最常见的意思就是“充电器”，但更地道、更常用的说法通常是“charger”。在北美英语中，人们更常说：phone charger / laptop charger。
构词法：recharge（再充电、补充能量）+ -er（表示“做某事的人/物”）。因此 recharger 字面意思是“用来充电的东西”。
注意不要和法语动词“recharger（再装填/补充）”混淆；英语对应动词是“recharge”。

summary.en: “Recharges” usually means “charges again” (a device/battery) or “restores energy,” and it can also mean repeated charges/top-ups.
summary.zh: “Recharges”通常指“再次充电/补充能量”，也可指多次充电/充值的次数或追加充值。

definition.en: (third-person singular) to fill something with energy again, especially a battery or device; to restore energy or strength.
definition.zh: （动词第三人称单数）给某物再次充电（尤指电池或设备）；也指恢复精力、体力。

examples.en: She recharges her phone every night.
examples.zh: 她每晚都给手机充电。

examples.en: A short walk outside recharges him after a long meeting.
examples.zh: 开完很长的会后，出去走一小段路能让他恢复精神。

definition.en: plural of recharge: repeated acts or instances of charging again or restoring energy; in some contexts, additional fees added to an account.
definition.zh: recharge 的复数：多次充电/补充能量的行为或次数；在某些语境中也指账户的追加充值费用。

examples.en: These batteries allow many recharges before they wear out.
examples.zh: 这些电池在报废前可以反复充电很多次。

examples.en: The prepaid plan includes two free recharges each month.
examples.zh: 这项预付费套餐每月包含两次免费充值。

extraExplanation: 在科技语境里，recharge最常见搭配是“recharge a battery/phone”，强调“再次充电”。在服务与通信领域，recharge也常指“给预付费账户充值”（top up）。在生活方式语境中，recharge常被借用来表示“恢复精力”，例如recharge your energy/mind。

summary.en: Recharging means charging again (especially a battery/device), and it can also describe something that helps you regain energy.
summary.zh: recharging 指再次充电（尤指电池/设备）；也可形容让人恢复精力、得到“充电”的事物。

definition.en: charging something again so it can be used (especially a battery or device)
definition.zh: 给某物再次充电以便继续使用（尤其指电池或电子设备）

examples.en: My phone is recharging right now, so I can’t take a call.
examples.zh: 我的手机正在充电，所以我现在不能接电话。

examples.en: Recharging the battery usually takes about two hours.
examples.zh: 给电池充电通常需要大约两小时。

definition.en: the process or time of charging again
definition.zh: 再次充电的过程或时间

examples.en: During recharging, the indicator light turns red.
examples.zh: 充电过程中，指示灯会变红。

examples.en: Frequent fast recharging can reduce battery life.
examples.zh: 频繁的快充可能会缩短电池寿命。

definition.en: helping you regain energy or strength; refreshing (often used about rest or activities)
definition.zh: 让人恢复精力的；令人精神焕发的（常指休息或活动）

examples.en: A quiet weekend at home can be really recharging.
examples.zh: 在家安静过个周末会很“充电”、很恢复精力。

examples.en: She took a recharging break after a busy week.
examples.zh: 忙了一周后，她休息了一下恢复精力。

extraExplanation: “recharge”原本多用于电池、设备等“再次充电”。在日常英语里也常被引申为“给自己充电”=通过休息、旅行、运动、独处等恢复精力（偏口语、积极语气）。

summary.en: Rechart means to make a chart again, usually with updated or corrected information.
summary.zh: Rechart 指重新制作图表，通常是用更新或更正后的信息来再出图。

definition.en: to create a new chart for something; to chart again (often with updated data or a different chart type)
definition.zh: 为某事重新制作图表；再次绘图（常指用更新的数据或换一种图表类型）

examples.en: After fixing the data errors, we recharted the sales trend.
examples.zh: 修正数据错误后，我们重新绘制了销售趋势图。

examples.en: Can you rechart this as a bar chart instead of a line chart?
examples.zh: 你能把这个重新画成柱状图，而不是折线图吗？

definition.en: to map or plan a course again (less common; used in navigation or planning)
definition.zh: 重新绘制航线/路线；重新规划行程（较少见，用于航海或计划）

examples.en: Because of the storm, the captain recharted the route.
examples.zh: 由于暴风雨，船长重新规划了航线。

extraExplanation: “rechart”在实际使用中常写作“re-chart”（加连字符），尤其在数据可视化、商业分析、编程文档里更清晰。意思通常就是“重新绘图/重新出图”。
它不是最常见的日常动词；在一般口语里也常用“make a new chart / redraw the chart / replot”来表达同样意思。

summary.en: “Recharted” means “charted again,” either literally (updating a map/route) or figuratively (resetting a plan or direction).
summary.zh: “recharted”表示“重新绘制/标绘”，既可指字面上的更新地图或航线，也可指引申义上的重新规划方向或策略。

definition.en: to draw or make a chart or map again; to update a route, area, or plan by creating a new chart/map
definition.zh: 重新绘制图表或地图；通过制作新的图表/地图来更新路线、区域或计划

examples.en: After the storm changed the coastline, the harbor was recharted for safety.
examples.zh: 风暴改变了海岸线后，为了安全，这个港口被重新绘制了海图。

examples.en: The team recharted the hiking route after several trails were closed.
examples.zh: 几条步道关闭后，团队重新绘制了徒步路线图。

definition.en: to plan again or set a new direction for something (often used in business or personal goals)
definition.zh: 重新规划；为某事设定新的方向（常用于商业或个人目标）

examples.en: With new data, the company recharted its strategy for the next quarter.
examples.zh: 有了新数据后，公司重新规划了下个季度的战略。

examples.en: After graduation, she recharted her career path toward teaching.
examples.zh: 毕业后，她重新规划了职业道路，转向教学。

extraExplanation: “recharted”是动词“rechart”的过去式/过去分词，由前缀“re-（再次、重新）”+“chart（海图/地图/图表；也可指规划）”组成。
在航海语境里更偏向“重新测绘海图/航道”；在商业或人生语境里更偏向“重新规划方向”。

summary.en: Recharter means to issue or renew an official charter, usually for a company, organization, or charter school.
summary.zh: recharter 指为公司、组织或特许学校等重新颁发或续发正式特许状/章程（更新其法律资格或授权）。

definition.en: to give an organization, company, or ship a new charter (official legal document), or to renew/replace its existing charter
definition.zh: （为组织/公司/船只）重新颁发特许状（章程等正式法律文件）；更新或替换原有特许状/章程

examples.en: The state voted to recharter the school for another five years.
examples.zh: 州政府投票决定将该学校的办学资格（特许状）再续五年。

examples.en: After the merger, the company had to recharter under a new legal structure.
examples.zh: 合并之后，公司必须在新的法律架构下重新注册并更新公司章程。

definition.en: the act or process of issuing a new charter or renewing a charter
definition.zh: 重新颁发或续发特许状/章程的行为或过程

examples.en: The recharter was approved unanimously by the board.
examples.zh: 董事会一致通过了重新颁发章程的决定。

extraExplanation: “charter”在英语里常指由政府或上级机构授予的正式权利或资格文件：例如公司章程（corporate charter）、特许学校的办学许可（charter school）、以及船舶或机构的特许/许可。recharter 常见于法律、商业治理和教育政策语境。

summary.en: “Rechartered” means an organization has been given a new or renewed legal charter (official permission and rules).
summary.zh: “rechartered”表示某个组织已被重新颁发或续发法律章程/特许（即重新获得官方许可与规则）。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “recharter”: to give an organization, company, or institution a new or renewed legal charter (official permission and rules), often after changes or renewal.
definition.zh: “recharter”的过去式/过去分词：为某个组织、公司或机构重新颁发或续发（法律）特许状/章程（正式的许可与规则），常用于变更或续期之后。

examples.en: The bank was rechartered under a new state law.
examples.zh: 该银行在新的州法律下被重新特许（重新颁发执照/章程）。

examples.en: After the merger, the nonprofit was rechartered with a new mission statement.
examples.zh: 合并后，这家非营利机构以新的使命声明重新获批章程。

definition.en: describing something that has been rechartered (given a new or renewed charter).
definition.zh: 形容词：指“已被重新颁发或续发章程/特许状的”。

examples.en: The rechartered university expanded its programs and governance structure.
examples.zh: 这所已重新获批章程的大学扩展了课程与治理结构。

extraExplanation: “charter”在英文里常指由政府或权威机构授予的“特许/章程/执照”，多用于银行、大学、城市、市政机构、非营利组织等；“recharter”则强调“重新批准、续期或在新规则下改发”。
在新闻或法律语境中，你可能会看到“be rechartered as … / be rechartered under …”，分别表示“改以……身份重新获批”与“依据……法律重新获批”。

summary.en: Rechartering means either giving an organization a new charter or chartering (hiring) a vehicle again.
summary.zh: Rechartering 指（1）为组织重新颁发章程/特许状；或（2）再次包租交通工具（如包机/包车/包船）。

definition.en: the act or process of giving a new charter (official permission or legal document) to an organization, often with updated rules, rights, or structure
definition.zh: （给组织）重新颁发章程/特许状的行为或过程，常伴随规则、权利或组织结构的更新

examples.en: The nonprofit is undergoing rechartering to meet the new state regulations.
examples.zh: 这家非营利组织正在进行重新颁发章程，以符合新的州法规。

examples.en: Rechartering can clarify the roles of the board and the executive director.
examples.zh: 重新颁发章程可以明确董事会与执行主任的职责分工。

definition.en: the act of chartering again—arranging to hire or rent a vehicle (such as a bus, plane, or boat) for a trip another time
definition.zh: 再次包租（如包车、包机、包船等）的行为——为新的行程重新安排租用运输工具

examples.en: After the schedule changed, they chose rechartering instead of keeping the original bus contract.
examples.zh: 行程变更后，他们选择重新包车，而不是继续原来的大巴合同。

examples.en: The company’s rechartering of the plane increased costs but avoided delays.
examples.zh: 公司重新包机增加了成本，但避免了延误。

extraExplanation: “rechartering”来自动词“recharter”（re- 表示“再次/重新” + charter 表示“章程/特许状；包租”）。在组织治理语境里，charter 常指组织的“成立文件/章程”（类似“宪章”）；在旅游与运输语境里，charter 常指“包机/包车/包船”。阅读时可通过上下文判断是哪一种含义。

summary.en: “Recharters” usually means “renews/grants a new charter,” giving an organization official legal recognition again.
summary.zh: “recharters”通常指“重新颁发/续签章程”，让某个组织再次获得官方法律认可。

definition.en: third-person singular of recharter: to grant a new charter to an organization (officially renew its legal status and rights).
definition.zh: recharter 的第三人称单数：为某个组织重新颁发章程（正式续签其法律地位与权利）。

examples.en: The government recharters the bank after the investigation is finished.
examples.zh: 调查结束后，政府为这家银行重新颁发章程。

examples.en: Our club recharters every year to stay recognized by the university.
examples.zh: 我们的社团每年都会重新注册/续章程，以保持学校的认可。

definition.en: less commonly, to charter again: to rent/hire a vehicle or service again (such as a plane or boat) under a new charter agreement.
definition.zh: 较少见：再次包租/包 charter（如再次按新合约包机、包船等）。

examples.en: The tour company recharters the same bus for the next season.
examples.zh: 这家旅行社在下一季又重新包租了同一辆大巴。

extraExplanation: “charter”常见有两层意思：①（法律/组织）“章程、特许状”；②（交通工具）“包租、租用（飞机/船/车等）”。因此 recharter 也会对应“重新颁发章程”或“再次包租”。在新闻、政府文件、学校社团语境里更常见的是①。
“recharters”通常出现在现在时（He/She/It recharters...）或作为名词复数的拼写误用；如果你想表达“重新颁发章程的行为/文件”，更自然的名词是 “rechartering” 或 “new charter”。

summary.en: Recharting means redrawing or updating a chart, map, or plan based on new or corrected information.
summary.zh: recharting 指根据新的或更正后的信息，重新绘制或更新图表、地图或计划。

definition.en: to make a chart again; to redraw or update a chart, map, or plan using new information
definition.zh: 重新制图；根据新信息重画或更新图表、地图或计划

examples.en: The team is recharting the sales data after discovering errors in last month’s report.
examples.zh: 团队在发现上个月报告有错误后，正在重新绘制销售数据图表。

examples.en: After the storm changed the shoreline, scientists began recharting the coastal area.
examples.zh: 暴风雨改变了海岸线后，科学家开始重新测绘沿海地区。

definition.en: the act or process of making a chart again; updating or redrawing charts or maps
definition.zh: 重新制图的行为或过程；对图表或地图进行更新或重绘

examples.en: Recharting took several days because they had to verify every data point.
examples.zh: 重新制图花了好几天，因为他们必须核对每一个数据点。

examples.en: The project includes recharting the route to make it safer for ships.
examples.zh: 该项目包括重新绘制航线，以便让船只航行更安全。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”。“rechart”在商业分析（更新图表）、航海/航空（更新航图）、地理测绘（重新测绘地图）等语境里较常见。
日常口语里更常用的表达有：“update the chart / redo the chart / redraw the map（更新/重做图表；重画地图）”。当强调因为新发现或新数据而“重新规划/重新制定方向”时，也可用比喻用法，如“rechart our strategy（重新规划策略）”。

summary.en: Recharts is a React charting library for building data visualizations.
summary.zh: Recharts 是一个用于 React 的图表库，用来制作数据可视化图表。

definition.en: a JavaScript charting library for React used to build charts (like line, bar, pie charts) with reusable components
definition.zh: 一个用于 React 的 JavaScript 图表库，用可复用组件来制作图表（如折线图、柱状图、饼图等）

examples.en: We use Recharts to display sales trends in a line chart.
examples.zh: 我们用 Recharts 把销售趋势做成折线图展示出来。

examples.en: Recharts makes it easier to create responsive charts that fit different screen sizes.
examples.zh: Recharts 可以更容易地做出能适配不同屏幕尺寸的响应式图表。

examples.en: This dashboard was built with React and Recharts.
examples.zh: 这个仪表盘是用 React 和 Recharts 做的。

extraExplanation: Recharts 是开源项目名称，常写作大写的 “Recharts”。它基于 React 的组件思想：你通过组合 <LineChart>、<XAxis>、<Tooltip> 等组件来搭出图表。
发音通常按英语读法拆开理解：re-（再/重新）+ charts（图表）。在口语里也有人直接说 “Re-charts”。

summary.en: Rechase means to chase again, and in metalworking it can mean to retool or restore chased details.
summary.zh: Rechase 指“再次追赶”；在金工中也可指“二次錾刻/修整被錾刻的细节”。

definition.en: to chase or pursue again; to follow after someone or something a second time
definition.zh: 再次追赶；重新追逐（某人或某物）

examples.en: After the dog slipped its leash, they had to rechase it down the street.
examples.zh: 狗挣脱牵引绳后，他们只好沿着街再追一次。

examples.en: The police stopped the car, but when the driver ran, they had to rechase him.
examples.zh: 警察拦下了车，但司机逃跑后，他们不得不再次追捕他。

definition.en: (arts/metalwork) to chase again: to rework details on a metal surface by tooling (for example, to sharpen lines or restore a design)
definition.zh: （艺术/金工）再次錾刻；对金属表面细部进行二次修整（如加深线条、修复图案）

examples.en: The jeweler rechased the pattern to make the details stand out.
examples.zh: 珠宝匠重新錾刻纹样，让细节更清晰。

examples.en: After polishing softened the design, the artist rechased the lines.
examples.zh: 抛光让图案变淡后，艺术家又把线条重新錾刻了一遍。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次”。因此 rechase 字面就是“再 chase 一次”。日常英语里这个词很少见，更常说 chase again / pursue again。
金工里的 chase 指用工具在金属表面“錾刻/錾花”来塑造纹理与细节；rechase 则是对这些细节做二次修整或复原。

summary.en: A rare word meaning “one who chases again; a renewed pursuer.”
summary.zh: 较少见，意为“再次追赶的人/重新追逐者”。

definition.en: Someone or something that chases again (returns to pursue after stopping or losing the target).
definition.zh: 重新追赶的人或事物（在停止或跟丢后再次追逐、追赶）。

examples.en: After a short rest, the runner became a rechaser and tried to catch the leaders again.
examples.zh: 短暂休息后，那位跑者成了“重新追赶者”，又试图追上领先者。

examples.en: In the story, the wolf is a rechaser, coming back again and again.
examples.zh: 在故事里，那只狼是个“反复追逐者”，一次又一次回来追赶。

extraExplanation: “rechaser”并不是常见英语词，通常是临时造词（re- “再次” + chaser “追逐者”），多见于特定语境（例如小说、游戏、口语描述）。更自然的表达常用：“chase again / pursue again / resume the chase（再次追赶）”。如果你本来想写的是“recharger（充电器/补充能量者）”或“chaser（追逐者/（酒后）下酒饮料）”，也可以告诉我上下文，我可以帮你确认。

summary.en: “Rechasten” means to chasten again—to correct, discipline, or humble someone once more, usually in formal or literary contexts.
summary.zh: “Rechasten”意为“再次惩戒/纠正/使人谦卑”，多用于较正式或文学语境。

definition.en: to chasten again; to discipline, correct, or humble someone once more (often in a moral or spiritual sense)
definition.zh: 再次惩戒；再度纠正、管教或使人谦卑（常带道德或宗教色彩）

examples.en: The mentor tried to rechasten the student after a second careless mistake.
examples.zh: 在学生第二次粗心犯错后，导师试图再次管教他。

examples.en: In the novel, the hero’s pride is rechastened by a new defeat.
examples.zh: 在小说中，主人公的傲慢因一次新的失败而再次被挫抑。

extraExplanation: “rechasten”由前缀 re-（再、重新）+ chasten（惩戒/磨炼/使谦卑）构成，整体语感偏书面、古典或宗教文本中更常见。日常英语里更常用 reprove again（再次责备）、discipline again（再次管教）、humble again（再次使谦卑）等更直白的表达。
chasten 不一定是“体罚”，也常指通过挫折或训诫让人变得更谨慎、克制或谦逊；因此 rechasten 也常带“再次被现实/经历磨炼”的意味。

summary.en: “re-chat” means to chat again or resume a conversation (informal).
summary.zh: “re-chat” 指（非正式）再次聊天或继续之前的对话。

definition.en: (informal) To chat again with someone; to resume a conversation after a break.
definition.zh: （非正式）再次和某人聊天；在中断后继续对话。

examples.en: Let’s re-chat tomorrow when you have more time.
examples.zh: 等你明天有时间，我们再聊。

examples.en: I’ll message you later so we can re-chat about the plan.
examples.zh: 我晚点发你消息，我们再聊聊这个计划。

extraExplanation:
“rechate” 不是常见拼写。更常见的写法是 **re-chat**（有时写作 *rechat*），表示“再聊一次/重新聊起”。
如果你想表达“把食物再加热”，你可能想查的是 **reheat**。
前缀 **re-** 表示“再次”，所以 *re-chat* = “再一次聊天”。在正式写作中，更自然的说法通常是 **talk again / chat again / reconnect**。

summary.en: Réchauffé means reheated leftovers, and by extension something (an idea or work) that is recycled and unoriginal.
summary.zh: réchauffé 指再加热的剩菜，也可引申为“翻炒旧内容、缺乏新意的东西”。

definition.en: reheated food, especially leftovers served again
definition.zh: 再加热的食物；（尤指）重新端上桌的剩菜

examples.en: For lunch we had a réchauffé of last night’s pasta.
examples.zh: 午餐我们吃了昨晚意大利面的再加热剩菜。

examples.en: The restaurant’s special was basically a réchauffé from yesterday.
examples.zh: 那家餐厅的“特餐”基本上是把昨天的菜再热一下。

definition.en: (of an idea, story, or style) repeated and not original; stale
definition.zh: （指想法、故事或风格）翻旧账的；缺乏新意的；陈腐的

examples.en: Critics called the plot a réchauffé of older movies.
examples.zh: 评论家说这个剧情是老电影的翻版。

examples.en: Her speech felt like a réchauffé of last year’s talking points.
examples.zh: 她的演讲听起来像是把去年的论点又热了一遍。

extraExplanation: 这是法语外来词，原意是“重新加热”。英语里多用于较正式或带一点讽刺的语气：不仅指“剩菜回锅”，也常用来形容“内容翻炒、缺乏新意”。
英语书写中常见两种形式：带重音符号的 réchauffé 和不带重音的 rechauffe；发音与法语风格接近。

summary.en: Rechauffes are reheated leftovers; figuratively, they are unoriginal “warmed-over” ideas or works.
summary.zh: rechauffes 指回锅的剩菜；也可比喻缺乏新意、在“炒冷饭”的观点或作品。

definition.en: (Usually plural) reheated leftovers; food served again after being cooked before.
definition.zh: （多用复数）回锅菜；再加热后再次端上的剩菜。

examples.en: The hotel breakfast was mostly rechauffes from last night’s banquet.
examples.zh: 这家酒店的早餐大多是昨晚宴会剩菜再加热的。

examples.en: I try not to waste food, so I eat rechauffes for lunch.
examples.zh: 我尽量不浪费食物，所以午饭会吃回锅的剩菜。

definition.en: (Figurative) something reused with little originality; a “warmed-over” idea or story.
definition.zh: （比喻）缺乏新意的重复之作；“炒冷饭”的点子或故事。

examples.en: The sequel felt like a rechauffe of the first movie.
examples.zh: 这部续集感觉像是在炒第一部电影的冷饭。

examples.en: Readers want fresh insights, not rechauffes of old arguments.
examples.zh: 读者想要新的见解，而不是对旧论点的炒冷饭。

definition.en: warmed-over; not fresh or original (often describing writing, art, or ideas).
definition.zh: 回锅的；（常指观点/作品）陈旧的、缺乏原创性的。

examples.en: His speech sounded rechauffe and predictable.
examples.zh: 他的演讲听起来像炒冷饭，毫无惊喜。

extraExplanation: 这是从法语 *réchauffé*（意为“重新加热的”）借来的词。英语里常写作 **rechauffe/rechauffé**，也常见复数 **rechauffes** 来泛指“回锅菜/剩菜”。
发音在英语里通常按“ray-shoh-FAY”来读；书写时很多英语文本会省略法语重音符号（é）。
语体上较偏书面或带一点幽默/讽刺色彩：说食物时较文雅，说作品或观点时常带“炒冷饭”的批评意味。

summary.en: Recharge means to charge a battery again or to rest and regain energy; it can also mean to add credit/money to an account.
summary.zh: Recharge 常指再次给电池充电，也可指休息恢复精力；还可表示给账户/卡充值。

definition.en: to fill a battery with electricity again; to charge again
definition.zh: （给电池）再次充电；充电恢复电量

examples.en: I need to recharge my phone before we go out.
examples.zh: 我们出门前我得先给手机充电。

examples.en: This power bank can recharge a tablet twice.
examples.zh: 这个充电宝可以给平板充两次电。

definition.en: to rest and get your energy back
definition.zh: 休息、恢复精力；“充电”

examples.en: I’m going to take a short walk to recharge.
examples.zh: 我打算短暂散步一下，恢复精力。

examples.en: She recharges by reading quietly at home.
examples.zh: 她通过在家安静阅读来“充电”。

definition.en: to add more money or credit to an account or card (often in British English)
definition.zh: （给账户/卡）充值、续费（英式英语更常见）

examples.en: You can recharge your transit card at the station.
examples.zh: 你可以在车站给交通卡充值。

extraExplanation: “rechaw”不是常见的英语单词拼写；最可能是你想写的是 **recharge**（充电/恢复精力）。如果你其实想查的是别的词（例如 *reach*、*recheck* 等），告诉我你想表达的中文意思或给一个例句，我可以帮你定位正确单词。

summary.en: A rare hunting term: a (repeated) horn call to recall or urge hounds; also to make that call.
summary.zh: 罕见的狩猎用语：指（重复的）号角召唤声，用来召回或催促猎犬；也可作动词指“吹这种召唤号”。

definition.en: (Hunting) a horn call used to recall or encourage hunting dogs (hounds), especially a repeated call; also the act of sounding this call.
definition.zh: （狩猎）用号角发出的召回或催促猎犬（猎狗群）的信号，尤指重复吹奏的召唤声；也指吹奏这一信号的行为。

examples.en: The huntsman sounded the recheat to gather the hounds after they scattered in the woods.
examples.zh: 猎手吹响了 recheat，把在树林里散开的猎犬召集回来。

examples.en: At the field meet, you could hear the recheat echo across the valley.
examples.zh: 在野外集合时，你能听到 recheat 在山谷间回响。

definition.en: (Hunting) to sound a repeated horn call to recall or urge hounds.
definition.zh: （狩猎）重复吹号角信号以召回或催促猎犬。

examples.en: If the pack loses the scent, the huntsman may recheat to bring them back in line.
examples.zh: 如果猎狗群失去气味线索，猎手可能会 recheat 来把它们召回并重新组织起来。

extraExplanation: 这是一个较少见、偏“传统英式猎狐/狩猎文化”的词。词根来自 re-（再次）+ cheat（这里不是“欺骗”，而是古义，指“号角信号/召唤声”）。因此 recheat 强调“再次吹号、重复召唤”。
在文学或历史语境中，你可能会在描写狩猎场景、号角信号（horn calls）、猎犬（hounds）与猎手（huntsman）的作品里见到它。现代日常英语里几乎不用。

summary.en: Recheat is a rare, old-fashioned hunting term for a repeated horn call—especially the recall signal—and it can also mean to blow that call.
summary.zh: Recheat 是罕见的古旧狩猎用语，指重复的号角声（尤指召回信号），也可作动词表示吹奏该信号。

definition.en: a repeated hunting-horn call (especially the “recall” signal) used to gather hunters or hounds back together
definition.zh: （尤指“召回”用的）重复吹奏的狩猎号角声，用来召集猎人或猎犬返回集合

examples.en: After the deer drive ended, the horn sounded a recheat to bring everyone back.
examples.zh: 围猎结束后，号角吹起了 recheat，把大家召回集合。

examples.en: The huntsman waited until the pack was scattered, then gave a clear recheat.
examples.zh: 猎犬队伍散开后，猎手吹出清晰的 recheat，示意返回。

definition.en: to sound (or repeat) a hunting-horn call, especially a recall signal
definition.zh: （尤指为召回而）吹奏或重复吹奏狩猎号角信号

examples.en: They recheated three times, but the dogs were slow to return.
examples.zh: 他们连吹三次 recheat，但猎犬回来的速度仍很慢。

examples.en: The rider recheated to call the group back to the path.
examples.zh: 骑手吹号（recheated）把队伍召回到小路上。

extraExplanation: “recheat”是非常少见、偏古旧的词，主要出现在英国传统狩猎/号角语境中。现代日常英语里几乎不用。
拼写上容易让人联想到常见词“reheat(s)”（再次加热），但含义完全不同；如果你想查的是“reheats”，告诉我我可以另给词条。

summary.en: Recheck means to check again to confirm correctness; it can also mean a second review.
summary.zh: recheck 指“再检查/复查”以确认是否正确；也可作名词表示“一次复查”。

definition.en: to check again in order to confirm something is correct, accurate, or finished
definition.zh: 再检查；复查（以确认正确、准确或完成）

examples.en: Please recheck your answers before you hand in the test.
examples.zh: 交卷前请复查你的答案。

examples.en: I rechecked the email address to make sure I sent it to the right person.
examples.zh: 我又核对了一遍邮箱地址，确保发给了对的人。

examples.en: The mechanic rechecked the engine after the repair.
examples.zh: 修理后，技师又复查了发动机。

definition.en: a second check or review
definition.zh: 复查；再次检查

examples.en: Give the report a quick recheck for spelling errors.
examples.zh: 把报告快速复查一下有没有拼写错误。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次/重新”。所以 recheck = check again。类似的还有 re-read（重读/再读）、rethink（重新思考）、reapply（重新申请）。

summary.en: “Rechecked” means checked again to confirm something is correct.
summary.zh: “rechecked” 表示“又检查/复核了一遍”，用来确认无误。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of recheck; checked again to confirm accuracy or find mistakes.
definition.zh: recheck 的过去式和过去分词；再次检查以确认准确或找出错误。

examples.en: I rechecked the address before leaving.
examples.zh: 出门前我又核对了一遍地址。

examples.en: The totals were rechecked to avoid billing errors.
examples.zh: 为避免账单错误，又重新核对了总数。

examples.en: She rechecked her answers and caught one small mistake.
examples.zh: 她重新检查了答案，发现了一个小错误。

definition.en: describing something that has been checked again (used before a noun).
definition.zh: （用于名词前）形容“已被再次检查过的”。

examples.en: Please send the rechecked report to the manager.
examples.zh: 请把复核后的报告发给经理。

examples.en: We only use rechecked data in the final version.
examples.zh: 最终版本只使用复核过的数据。

extraExplanation: 前缀 re- 表示“再、重新”。所以 recheck = check again（再检查一次），常用于强调“确认无误”或“避免错误”。
和 double-check 相比：double-check 更口语、更常用于“为了保险再确认一次”；recheck 更中性，也常用于工作流程中的“复核/复查”。

summary.en: Rechecking means checking something again to make sure it’s correct.
summary.zh: rechecking 指“重新检查/复核”，用来确认是否正确无误。

definition.en: the act of checking something again to confirm it is correct, complete, or working properly
definition.zh: 重新检查；复核（为了确认是否正确、完整或运作正常）

examples.en: Thanks for rechecking the numbers before we send the report.
examples.zh: 谢谢你在发送报告前重新核对这些数字。

examples.en: I’m rechecking my email to make sure I attached the file.
examples.zh: 我在重新检查邮件，确认我已经把文件附上了。

definition.en: to check something again in order to confirm, correct, or verify it
definition.zh: 再次检查；复查；核实（以确认、纠正或验证）

examples.en: Could you recheck the address for me?
examples.zh: 你能帮我再核对一下地址吗？

examples.en: The technician rechecked the system after the update.
examples.zh: 更新后，技术员又检查了一遍系统。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再一次”，所以 recheck = check again。日常写作里常见更自然的表达有：double-check（再三确认）、check again（再检查一次）、verify（核实）。其中 double-check 语气更口语、更强调“确认无误”。
拼写上既可写作 recheck，也可写作 re-check；美式英语里通常更常见连写 recheck。

summary.en: “Rechecks” means checks again (verb) or additional checks (plural noun) to confirm something is correct.
summary.zh: “rechecks”表示“再次检查”（动词第三人称单数）或“复查/再次检查”（名词复数），用于确认准确无误。

definition.en: to check something again to confirm it is correct or to avoid mistakes
definition.zh: 再次检查（某事）以确认正确或避免错误

examples.en: She rechecks the numbers before sending the report.
examples.zh: 她在发送报告前会再次核对数字。

examples.en: Please recheck your email address—one small typo can stop the message.
examples.zh: 请再检查一下你的邮箱地址——一个小拼写错误就可能导致邮件发不出去。

definition.en: another check or review done to confirm accuracy
definition.zh: 复查；再次检查（一次额外的核对/审核）

examples.en: After a quick recheck, we found the missing file.
examples.zh: 快速复查后，我们找到了缺失的文件。

extraExplanation: “rechecks”通常是动词“recheck”的第三人称单数（He/She/It rechecks...），也可能是名词“recheck”的复数（two rechecks）。
前缀“re-”表示“再一次”，常见于rebuild（重建）、rewrite（重写）、rethink（重新思考）等。

summary.en: Recheer means to cheer someone up again or to become cheerful again.
summary.zh: Recheer 指“再次鼓舞/使重新振作”，也可指“重新变得愉快”。

definition.en: to cheer again; to make someone feel happy or hopeful again
definition.zh: 再次鼓舞；让某人重新振作、恢复愉快或希望

examples.en: A kind message can recheer someone who’s having a hard day.
examples.zh: 一句温暖的话可以让度过艰难一天的人重新振作。

examples.en: The team’s captain tried to recheer the players after the loss.
examples.zh: 队长在失利后努力让队员们重拾士气。

definition.en: to become cheerful again; to regain good spirits
definition.zh: 重新变得愉快；恢复精神、重拾好心情

examples.en: After some rest, she began to recheer and smile again.
examples.zh: 休息一会儿后，她开始重新振作并再次露出笑容。

extraExplanation: “recheer”比较少见，更常用的表达是“cheer up（使振作）”、“brighten（使心情变好）”或“lift someone’s spirits（鼓舞某人）”。在写作中用“recheer”会显得有点文学/古风，适合强调“重新恢复愉快”。
构词上：re-（再一次）+ cheer（欢呼/使愉快）。这个“re-”强调“恢复到原先的好心情”。

summary.en: Research means careful study or investigation, and it can also mean to study something carefully to find information.
summary.zh: Research 指认真研究/调查；也可作动词，表示为获取信息而仔细研究。

definition.en: Careful study to discover new facts or understand something better; a detailed investigation.
definition.zh: 为发现新事实或更好理解某事而进行的认真研究；详细调查。

examples.en: She is doing research on how people learn languages.
examples.zh: 她正在研究人们如何学习语言。

examples.en: The report is based on years of medical research.
examples.zh: 这份报告基于多年的医学研究。

definition.en: To study something carefully in order to find information or develop new knowledge.
definition.zh: 仔细研究某事以获取信息或发展新知识。

examples.en: Before buying a laptop, I researched different models online.
examples.zh: 买笔记本电脑之前，我在网上研究了不同型号。

examples.en: Scientists are researching a new treatment.
examples.zh: 科学家正在研究一种新疗法。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“recherch”在英语里通常不是标准拼写；最常见的目标词是“research”。另外，法语里有“recherche”（寻找/研究）这个词，在学术或机构名称中偶尔会看到（如“Centre de Recherche”）。
“research”既可作名词也可作动词；在学术语境中很常见的搭配有：do research（做研究）、conduct research（开展研究）、research findings（研究发现）、research paper（研究论文）。

summary.en: Recherché describes something unusually refined and carefully chosen, often appealing to a niche audience.
summary.zh: recherché 形容某物“讲究精致但偏小众”，常指品味或选择过于细致、只吸引少数懂行的人。

definition.en: (of something, especially a taste, style, or topic) Unusually refined, rare, or “too carefully chosen”; appealing mainly to a small, knowledgeable group.
definition.zh: （尤指品味、风格或话题）过于讲究、罕见而精致的；偏小众、只吸引少数行家/懂的人。

examples.en: The café is known for its recherché desserts, like rose-pistachio pastries.
examples.zh: 这家咖啡馆以小众讲究的甜点出名，比如玫瑰开心果酥点。

examples.en: His jokes are a bit recherché, so not everyone understands them.
examples.zh: 他的笑点有点小众，不是每个人都能懂。

examples.en: She prefers a recherché perfume that you won’t find in most stores.
examples.zh: 她更喜欢那种很小众的香水，在大多数店里买不到。

definition.en: (less common) Carefully researched; scholarly and specialized.
definition.zh: （较少见）经过细致研究的；学术性强、专业且偏专门领域的。

examples.en: The article offers a recherché discussion of early American printing.
examples.zh: 这篇文章对美国早期印刷史做了相当深入专业的讨论。

examples.en: It’s a recherché topic, but the lecture was surprisingly clear.
examples.zh: 这是个很专业冷门的话题，但讲座讲得出奇地清楚。

extraExplanation: “recherché”是从法语借来的词（法语里原意接近“精心搜寻/讲究挑选”）。英语里常用来形容“品味很讲究但偏小众”，语气有时带一点点“太装、太挑剔/太学究”的感觉，具体取决于上下文。
拼写上常见带重音符号：recherché；但英文文本里也常写成recherche或recherché。发音结尾常读成类似“shay”。

summary.en: Rechew means to chew something again, or (figuratively) to repeat and rehash the same ideas.
summary.zh: Rechew 指“再咀嚼一次”，也可比喻“反复讨论、老调重弹”。

definition.en: to chew again; to chew something a second time (literal or figurative).
definition.zh: 再咀嚼；把某物再嚼一遍（可指字面或比喻意义）。

examples.en: The dog rechewed the bone after burying it in the yard.
examples.zh: 那只狗把骨头埋在院子里后，又拿出来再咀嚼。

examples.en: Let’s not rechew the same argument—can we move on to solutions?
examples.zh: 别再反复咀嚼同一个争论了——我们能不能转到解决办法？

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再一次/重新”。“rechew”在日常英语里不算常用，写作中更常见的是比喻用法，意思接近“反复讨论/老调重弹”。
比喻用法里，常见搭配是“rechew the same topic/argument/ideas（反复谈同一个话题/争论/想法）”。更中性的替代说法有“revisit (a topic)”或“go over it again”。

summary.en: Rechewed means chewed again, or (figuratively) repeated/rehash without new ideas.
summary.zh: rechewed 表示“再次咀嚼”，也可比喻“老调重弹、反复重复却没有新意”。

definition.en: to chew again; to chew something a second time
definition.zh: 再次咀嚼；把某物再咬嚼一遍

examples.en: The dog rechewed the bone until it was soft enough to eat.
examples.zh: 那只狗把骨头又咬嚼了一遍，直到软得能吃为止。

examples.en: She rechewed her food slowly to avoid choking.
examples.zh: 她慢慢把食物再咀嚼一下，以免噎到。

definition.en: (figurative) to think about or discuss something again, often without adding anything new
definition.zh: （比喻）把某事再想一遍或再讨论一遍（常带“反复老调、没新意”的意味）

examples.en: The meeting just rechewed the same arguments from last week.
examples.zh: 这次会议只是把上周的争论又重复了一遍。

examples.en: He kept rechewing old regrets instead of moving forward.
examples.zh: 他一直反复琢磨过去的遗憾，而不是向前看。

definition.en: (figurative, of ideas or content) repeated and overused; not original
definition.zh: （比喻，用于观点/内容）被反复炒作的；陈词滥调的；缺乏新意的

examples.en: The article felt like rechewed advice you can find anywhere online.
examples.zh: 那篇文章读起来像是网上随处可见的“老生常谈”。

examples.en: The show relies on rechewed jokes that stopped being funny years ago.
examples.zh: 这个节目靠的是多年前就不好笑的老梗。

extraExplanation: “re-”有“再次”的意思，rechew 字面就是“再咀嚼”。在写作里常用来形容观点被反复提起、缺乏新内容（语气偏负面），类似于“rehash（老调重弹）”。

summary.en: “Rechews” means “chews again,” or figuratively “revisits the same idea repeatedly.”
summary.zh: “rechews” 表示“再次咀嚼（反刍）”，也可比喻“反复琢磨/反复谈论同一想法”。

definition.en: to chew again; to chew something a second time (often used for animals like cows)
definition.zh: 再次咀嚼；把（食物）再嚼一遍（常用于牛等反刍动物）

examples.en: Cows rechew their food while resting.
examples.zh: 牛在休息时会把食物再咀嚼（反刍）。

examples.en: If the meat is tough, chew slowly and you may find yourself rechewing it.
examples.zh: 如果肉很韧，慢慢嚼，你可能会不自觉地再嚼几次。

definition.en: (figurative) to think about or discuss an idea again, especially in a repetitive way
definition.zh: （比喻）反复思考或反复谈论某个想法（带有重复之意）

examples.en: We don’t need to rechew old arguments—let’s focus on solutions.
examples.zh: 我们不需要反复纠结旧争论——把注意力放在解决方案上。

examples.en: He kept rechewing the same complaint in every meeting.
examples.zh: 他在每次会议上都反复抱怨同一件事。

extraExplanation: “rechews” 是动词 “rechew” 的第三人称单数现在时：he/she/it rechews。常见搭配有 “rechew food / rechew cud（反刍）”。
容易与 “eschew”（刻意避开）混淆：rechew = 再咀嚼/反复思考；eschew = 避免、不采用。

summary.en: Rechip most commonly means to replace or install a new microchip in a device (or to microchip an animal again).
summary.zh: Rechip 最常指给设备更换/安装新的微芯片；也可指给动物重新植入身份识别芯片。

definition.en: to replace or install a new microchip (or set of chips) in a device, usually to repair it or upgrade its performance
definition.zh: 给设备更换或安装新的微芯片（或芯片组），通常用于修理或升级性能

examples.en: The technician rechipped the phone after the original chip failed.
examples.zh: 原来的芯片坏了之后，技术员给这部手机换了芯片。

examples.en: Some older cars can be rechipped to improve fuel efficiency.
examples.zh: 一些老款汽车可以通过更换/改装芯片来提升燃油效率。

definition.en: to put a new identification microchip into an animal (again), especially after loss or a change of ownership
definition.zh: （再次）给动物植入身份识别芯片，常见于芯片丢失或更换主人时

examples.en: The shelter rechipped the dog before adoption.
examples.zh: 收容所在领养前给这只狗重新植入了芯片。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，chip 在这里指“芯片（microchip）”。在电子维修或改装语境里，rechip 常与 upgrade（升级）、repair（修理）一起出现。
口语中也可能用 re-chip / rechip 指“重新分配筹码”，但这种用法不如在“更换芯片”意义上常见，具体含义要看上下文（赌场、牌局等）。

summary.en: “Rechisel” means to chisel again to refine, correct, or restore a carved surface.
summary.zh: “rechisel”指“重新凿刻”，用凿子再加工以修整、纠正或修复雕刻表面。

definition.en: to chisel again; to reshape or refine something by cutting it again with a chisel (often to correct or improve the shape or details)
definition.zh: 再次用凿子雕凿；通过重新凿刻来修整或完善（常指纠正或加强细节）

examples.en: The restorer rechiseled the worn letters so the inscription could be read.
examples.zh: 修复师重新凿刻磨损的字母，让题字变得清晰可读。

examples.en: After the mistake, the sculptor rechiseled the edge to make it sharper.
examples.zh: 出错之后，雕刻家重新修整边缘，使它更锋利。

extraExplanation: “rechisel”由前缀 re-（表示“再次、重新”）+ chisel（凿子；用凿子雕刻）构成，多见于雕塑、石材加工、木工、文物修复等语境。
它不是日常高频词；在一般场景里，也可用更常见的表达，如 “chisel again,” “re-carve,” “rework,” 或 “touch up” 来替代，语气更自然。

summary.en: Rechoose means to choose again after changing your mind or when circumstances change.
summary.zh: rechoose 指在改变主意或情况变化后“重新选择”。

definition.en: to choose again, often after reconsidering or when the first choice is no longer possible
definition.zh: 重新选择；再选一次（常指重新考虑后，或原先选择不再可行时）

examples.en: If your first option is unavailable, you can rechoose from the list.
examples.zh: 如果你的第一选择不可用，你可以从名单里重新选择。

examples.en: After reading more reviews, she decided to rechoose her laptop.
examples.zh: 看了更多评价后，她决定重新选择她的笔记本电脑。

extraExplanation: “rechoose”由前缀 re-（再次）+ choose（选择）构成，意思直观，但在日常英语里不如 “choose again / make a new choice / reconsider your choice” 常见。正式写作中也常用 “reselect”。

summary.en: “Rechooses” means “chooses again,” sometimes used formally for “elects again.”
summary.zh: rechooses 表示“再次选择”，有时也可较正式地表示“再次选举（连任）”。

definition.en: to choose again; to make a new choice after deciding before
definition.zh: 再次选择；在之前做过决定后重新作出选择

examples.en: If the first plan doesn’t work, she rechooses a different one.
examples.zh: 如果第一个计划行不通，她会重新选择另一个。

examples.en: He rechooses his major after taking a few classes.
examples.zh: 上了几门课后，他重新选择了自己的专业。

definition.en: to elect someone again for the same position (more formal)
definition.zh: （较正式）再次选举某人担任同一职位；连任

examples.en: The community rechooses the mayor for a second term.
examples.zh: 社区再次选举这位市长连任第二个任期。

examples.en: The board rechooses her as chair because of her experience.
examples.zh: 董事会因她经验丰富而再次选她担任主席。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次”。“choose”的过去式是“chose”，过去分词是“chosen”。本词条是第三人称单数现在时：he/she/it rechooses。写作时注意拼写：rechoose + -es → rechooses。

summary.en: “Rechoosing” means choosing again or making a new choice after an earlier one.
summary.zh: “rechoosing”表示“重新选择/再选一次”，即在先前选择之后做出新的选择。

definition.en: choosing again; making a new choice after a previous choice (often because the first option was not suitable).
definition.zh: 重新选择；在已经做过选择之后再做一次新的选择（常因原先的选项不合适）。

examples.en: After seeing the menu, she started rechoosing her lunch.
examples.zh: 看完菜单后，她开始重新选择午餐。

examples.en: We’re rechoosing our destination because of the weather.
examples.zh: 因为天气原因，我们正在重新选择目的地。

examples.en: The team spent the afternoon rechoosing a name for the project.
examples.zh: 团队花了一下午重新选择项目名称。

extraExplanation: “rechoosing”是动词 rechoose（重新选择）的现在分词/动名词形式。更口语、更常见的说法通常是 choose again（再选一次）或 make a new choice（做出新选择）。
拼写上要注意：re + choosing 中间不会加连字符，一般写作 rechoosing。

summary.en: “Rechose” means “chose again” (past tense of rechoose).
summary.zh: “rechose”表示“再次选择/重新选择”，是 rechoose 的过去式。

definition.en: Past tense of rechoose: chose again; selected again after reconsidering.
definition.zh: rechoose 的过去式：再一次选择；重新选定。

examples.en: After reading the reviews, I rechose a different hotel.
examples.zh: 看完评价后，我重新选了另一家酒店。

examples.en: They rechose her as team leader for another year.
examples.zh: 他们再次选她担任团队负责人一年。

extraExplanation: “rechose”来自动词“rechoose”（re- 表示“再次/重新” + choose）。choose 的过去式是不规则变化“chose”，所以 rechoose 的过去式也跟着变成 rechose（不是 *rechoosed）。
在正式写作中，有时也会用“chose again / chose another”来表达同样意思，更自然直观。

summary.en: “Rechosen” means “chosen again,” often describing someone or something selected a second time.
summary.zh: “rechosen”意为“再次被选中”，常用于描述某人或某物第二次被挑选/选出。

definition.en: chosen again; selected a second time (often used as a past participle or adjective).
definition.zh: 再次被选中的；第二次被挑选的（常作过去分词或形容词用）。

examples.en: She was rechosen as team captain for another year.
examples.zh: 她再次被选为球队队长，任期又一年。

examples.en: The rechosen committee members already know the rules.
examples.zh: 再次当选的委员已经熟悉规则。

definition.en: past participle of “rechoose”: to choose someone or something again.
definition.zh: “rechoose”的过去分词：再次选择某人或某物。

examples.en: After the vote, two speakers were rechosen to represent the group.
examples.zh: 投票后，有两位发言人再次被选出代表团队。

extraExplanation: “rechosen”来自动词“rechoose（再次选择）”，但在现代英语里更常见的表达是“re-elected（再度当选）”“chosen again（再次被选中）”。
在政治/组织语境中，选举类场景通常用“re-elected”，而“rechosen”更像一般性的“再次挑选”，用于较广泛、非正式或文学化的表达中。

summary.en: Rechristen means to rename something, often officially or symbolically.
summary.zh: rechristen 指为某物重新命名，常带正式或象征意义。

definition.en: to give something a new name; to rename (often in an official or symbolic way)
definition.zh: 给某物起一个新名字；重新命名（常带正式或象征意味）

examples.en: The city decided to rechristen the park after a famous poet.
examples.zh: 市政府决定以一位著名诗人的名字重新命名这座公园。

examples.en: After the merger, the company rechristened the product line to match the new brand.
examples.zh: 合并之后，公司为配合新品牌而重新命名产品线。

definition.en: to name something again in a religious or ceremonial sense (less common)
definition.zh: （较少见）以宗教或仪式的方式再次命名／再行“命名礼”

examples.en: Some traditions do not allow a person to be rechristened, but they may hold a new naming ceremony.
examples.zh: 有些传统不允许为同一个人再次施行洗礼式命名，但可能会举行新的命名仪式。

extraExplanation: “rechristen”由 re-（再次）+ christen（为……命名；也指“施洗礼并取教名”）组成。现代日常语境里更常用作“重新命名”，不一定带宗教含义。
在新闻与商业语境中很常见：城市、公司、产品、项目、舰船等被“rechristen”表示改名，常暗示形象更新、纪念人物或战略调整。

summary.en: “Rechristened” means “renamed” (and more rarely, “baptized again”).
summary.zh: “rechristened”主要表示“被重新命名/改名”；较少情况下表示“再次受洗”。

definition.en: given a new name; renamed (often for a place, product, organization, or event).
definition.zh: 被重新命名；改名（常用于地点、产品、组织或活动）。

examples.en: The company rechristened the app after the update.
examples.zh: 公司在更新后给这款应用改了名。

examples.en: The street was rechristened to honor a local teacher.
examples.zh: 这条街被重新命名，以纪念一位当地教师。

definition.en: baptized again; formally given a Christian name again (rare, usually historical or religious context).
definition.zh: 再次受洗；再次被正式赋予基督教姓名（较少见，多用于宗教或历史语境）。

examples.en: After returning to the church, he was rechristened in a private ceremony.
examples.zh: 他回到教会后，在一场私密仪式中再次受洗。

extraExplanation: “rechristen”原意与“christen（为婴儿施洗并取基督教名）”有关，但在现代英语里更常用作比喻，表示“给……改名/重新命名”，不一定带宗教含义。
形式说明：rechristened 是 re-christen 的过去式/过去分词；在新闻与历史写作中常见（例如城市、街道、战舰或项目被“重新命名”）。

summary.en: Rechristening means renaming something, often in an official or ceremonial way.
summary.zh: Rechristening 指为某物重新命名，常带有正式或仪式性的意味。

definition.en: the act of giving something a new name; renaming (often an official or public change)
definition.zh: 给某物重新命名的行为；改名（常指正式或公开的改名）

examples.en: The company held a ceremony for the rechristening of the stadium.
examples.zh: 公司为体育场的重新命名举行了仪式。

examples.en: After the merger, the rechristening of the brand was announced on TV.
examples.zh: 并购后，品牌改名在电视上宣布了。

definition.en: the act of naming something again in a “christening” style ceremony (for example, a ship)
definition.zh: 以“命名/洗礼”式仪式再次为某物命名（例如为船只举行命名仪式）

examples.en: There was a small rechristening when the ship was repaired and returned to service.
examples.zh: 这艘船修复并重新投入使用时，举行了一次小型的重新命名仪式。

examples.en: They invited the mayor to the rechristening and launch event.
examples.zh: 他们邀请市长参加重新命名和下水活动。

extraExplanation: “rechristening”来自动词“rechristen”（re- 表示“再次” + christen 表示“为……命名/举行命名仪式”）。christen 原本与基督教的“洗礼”有关，所以 rechristening 有时带一点“郑重其事、带仪式感地改名”的语气。
在现代英语里，它常用于品牌、项目、组织或场馆的改名，也常见于船只、飞机等交通工具的“重新命名仪式”。

summary.en: Rechristenings means the acts or events of giving something a new name (renamings), sometimes referring to formal naming ceremonies.
summary.zh: rechristenings 指给某物重新命名的行为或事件（改名），有时也指正式的更名/命名仪式。

definition.en: the acts or occasions of giving something a new name; renamings
definition.zh: 给某物重新命名的行为或事件；改名

examples.en: The company announced several rechristenings after the merger.
examples.zh: 并购后，公司宣布了多项重新命名。

examples.en: These rechristenings were meant to make the products easier to recognize.
examples.zh: 这些改名是为了让产品更容易被辨认。

definition.en: new naming ceremonies (especially in a religious or formal setting)
definition.zh: 重新命名的仪式（尤指宗教或正式场合）

examples.en: The town held rechristenings of the streets to honor local heroes.
examples.zh: 小镇举行了街道更名仪式，以纪念当地英雄。

examples.en: In the story, the rechristenings marked a new beginning for the characters.
examples.zh: 在故事里，这些重新命名的仪式象征人物的新开始。

extraExplanation: “rechristen” = re-（再、重新）+ christen（为……命名/施洗名）。现代英语里多用于“改名、重新命名”，不一定带宗教含义，但在谈到船只、建筑、项目等的更名时很常见。
“rechristenings”是复数名词，常出现在新闻或商业语境：品牌重塑、合并后部门/产品改名、公共场所更名等。

summary.en: “Rechristens” means “renames” or “gives a new identity,” in third-person singular present tense.
summary.zh: “rechristens”表示“重新命名/赋予新身份”，为第三人称单数现在时。

definition.en: to give someone or something a new name; to rename
definition.zh: 给某人或某物起新名字；重新命名

examples.en: The company rechristens its flagship product every few years to match new features.
examples.zh: 这家公司每隔几年就会给旗舰产品重新命名，以配合新功能。

examples.en: After the merger, the team rechristens the project with a shorter, friendlier title.
examples.zh: 合并之后，团队把项目重新命名为一个更短、更好记的名称。

definition.en: (often figurative) to redefine or present someone or something with a new identity, role, or image
definition.zh: （常为比喻）赋予某人或某物新的身份、角色或形象；重新塑造

examples.en: The press rechristens the young actor as the “new face” of action movies.
examples.zh: 媒体把这位年轻演员塑造成动作片的“新面孔”。

examples.en: She rechristens her difficult past as a source of strength.
examples.zh: 她把艰难的过去重新定义为力量的来源。

extraExplanation: “rechristen”字面含义与基督教的“christen（受洗时取名）”有关，因此带有“重新取名/再命名”的意味；现代英语中多用于品牌、项目、地点等改名，也常用于比喻性“重新定义形象/身份”。
“rechristens”是第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it rechristens）。

summary.en: “Recht” is a German/Dutch word meaning “law” or “a right,” and in German it can also mean “correct” (as in “You’re right”).
summary.zh: “Recht”是德语/荷兰语词，常表示“法律”或“权利”；在德语口语中也可表示“正确”（相当于“你说得对”）。

definition.en: (from German or Dutch) law; the system of rules a country or group uses to control behavior.
definition.zh: （源自德语或荷兰语）法律；一个国家或群体用来规范行为的规则体系。

examples.en: In German, Recht can mean “law,” as in criminal law.
examples.zh: 在德语里，Recht 可以表示“法律”，例如“刑法”。

examples.en: She studied Recht and politics in Europe.
examples.zh: 她在欧洲学习法律与政治。

definition.en: (from German or Dutch) a right; something you are allowed to do or have, often protected by law.
definition.zh: （源自德语或荷兰语）权利；你被允许做或拥有的事物，常受法律保护。

examples.en: Freedom of speech is a basic Recht in many democracies.
examples.zh: 言论自由在许多民主国家是一项基本权利。

examples.en: They argued about workers’ Rechte and fair pay.
examples.zh: 他们就工人的权利与公平薪酬展开争论。

definition.en: (German, informal) being correct; having the right answer.
definition.zh: （德语，非正式）正确；答对了。

examples.en: He said, “Du hast recht,” meaning “You’re right.”
examples.zh: 他说“Du hast recht”，意思是“你是对的”。

extraExplanation: “Recht”在德语中常与法律与社会制度相关：如 Rechtsstaat（法治国家）、Rechtsanwalt（律师）。在日常口语里，“recht haben”=“说得对/没错”。
在荷兰语中，recht 也可表示“法律/权利”，并常出现在短语里，如 “recht hebben op …”（有权享有……）。注意它不是英语单词，英语里通常用 law / right 来表达。

summary.en: “Rechuck” is informal slang meaning to vomit again (most common), and sometimes to throw something back or spit it out.
summary.zh: “rechuck”是非正式俚语，最常见意思是“又吐了/再次呕吐”，也可指“把东西扔回去或吐出来”（较少见）。

definition.en: (informal, slang) To vomit again; to throw up what you have eaten or drunk.
definition.zh: （非正式/俚语）再次呕吐；把吃下或喝下的东西又吐出来。

examples.en: I felt sick after the ride and had to rechuck behind the building.
examples.zh: 坐完那趟车我觉得很恶心，只好在楼后又吐了。

examples.en: If you eat too fast, you might rechuck.
examples.zh: 如果你吃得太快，可能会又吐出来。

definition.en: (informal) To throw something back, return it, or spit it out (less common).
definition.zh: （非正式）把某物扔回去/退回去，或吐出来（较少见）。

examples.en: He bit into the sandwich, tasted something off, and rechucked it into the trash.
examples.zh: 他咬了一口三明治，觉得味道不对，就把它吐回垃圾桶里了。

extraExplanation: “rechuck”属于口语俚语，带一点粗俗/搞笑的语气；更中性的说法是“vomit/throw up”。在正式写作、课堂或商务场合建议避免使用。
构词上常被理解为“re-（再次）+ chuck（扔）”，形象地表达“又吐/又扔出来”。

summary.en: Rechurn means customers leave a service again after coming back (or repeatedly switching).
summary.zh: Rechurn 指用户回流后又再次流失（或反复更换服务商）。

definition.en: (Business/marketing, especially telecom/subscriptions) to churn again; to leave a service and then leave again after returning (or to repeatedly switch providers).
definition.zh: （商业/市场营销，尤指电信/订阅服务）再次流失；指用户回流后又再次退订/更换服务商，或反复在不同服务商之间切换。

examples.en: The company is tracking rechurn to see how many returning customers leave again within three months.
examples.zh: 公司在追踪“再次流失”，看有多少回流用户在三个月内又离开。

examples.en: High rechurn often means the product problems were never really fixed.
examples.zh: “再次流失”很高往往说明产品问题并没有真正解决。

definition.en: a repeated churn event; the act or rate of customers leaving again after returning.
definition.zh: 再次流失（事件/行为/比率）；指用户回流后又离开的次数或比例。

examples.en: Their rechurn rate dropped after they improved customer support.
examples.zh: 他们改善客服后，“再次流失率”下降了。

examples.en: Rechurn is costly because you pay to win customers back and then lose them again.
examples.zh: 再次流失很昂贵，因为你花钱把用户拉回来，却又再次失去他们。

extraExplanation: “rechurn”通常写作 re-churn 或 rechurn，属于行业术语（多见于订阅制/电信/流媒体等）。它强调的是“回流（win-back / return）之后又流失”的那一轮，不同于一般的 churn（首次流失）。
常见相关词：churn（用户流失）、win-back/returning customer（挽回/回流用户）、retention（留存）、reactivation（重新激活）。

summary.en: “Recide” is usually a misspelling of “reside,” meaning to live somewhere or (formally) to exist in something.
summary.zh: “recide”通常是“reside”的拼写错误，意思是“居住在某地”，或（较正式）“存在于/蕴含在某物中”。

definition.en: (Common misspelling) Most likely you mean “reside”: to live in a place; to have your home in a particular location.
definition.zh: （常见拼写错误）你很可能想写的是“reside”：居住在某地；以某地为家。

examples.en: She resides in New York with her family.
examples.zh: 她和家人住在纽约。

examples.en: Do you reside at this address year-round?
examples.zh: 你全年都住在这个地址吗？

examples.en: The right to make this decision resides with the manager.
examples.zh: 作出这个决定的权力在经理手中。

definition.en: Less common: to exist or be found in something (often used in formal writing).
definition.zh: 较不常见：存在于；蕴含在（常用于较正式的表达）。

examples.en: The problem resides in the way the data was collected.
examples.zh: 问题出在数据的收集方式上。

examples.en: Her confidence resides in careful preparation.
examples.zh: 她的自信来自充分的准备。

extraExplanation:
“recide”本身不是标准英语单词，常见可能是拼错：
- reside /rɪˈzaɪd/（居住；存在于）
- recite /rɪˈsaɪt/（背诵；朗诵）
- decide /dɪˈsaɪd/（决定）
如果你告诉我你想表达的中文意思或给一个句子，我可以帮你确认到底是哪一个。

summary.en: Recidivate means to relapse—especially to commit crimes again after punishment or improvement.
summary.zh: Recidivate 指“再度复发”，尤其是“受罚或好转后再次犯罪/再犯”。

definition.en: (of a person) to relapse into criminal behavior after being punished or after a period of improvement.
definition.zh: （人）在受罚或一段时间好转后，再次犯案；再度重返犯罪。

examples.en: The program aims to help former prisoners avoid recidivating after release.
examples.zh: 这个项目旨在帮助前囚犯出狱后避免再次犯罪。

examples.en: Without stable housing and work, some people recidivate within a year.
examples.zh: 如果没有稳定的住房和工作，有些人会在一年内再次犯罪。

definition.en: to relapse into a previous, usually undesirable, pattern of behavior or condition.
definition.zh: （更广义）复发；重回先前（通常不良）的行为模式或状态。

examples.en: Under stress, he may recidivate into old habits like smoking.
examples.zh: 在压力之下，他可能会复发，回到抽烟等旧习惯。

examples.en: The team worried the situation would recidivate into chaos.
examples.zh: 团队担心局势会再次滑向混乱。

extraExplanation: “recidivate”多见于法律、犯罪学与公共政策语境，比日常用词更正式。更常见的表达是“reoffend”（再次犯罪）或“relapse”（复发/故态复萌）。
词源与“recidivism”（再犯率/累犯现象）同源，来自拉丁语，含“重新落下/再度回到原处”的意思。常见搭配：recidivate into + 旧习惯/旧模式；recidivate after release（出狱后再犯）。

summary.en: “Recidivated” means “reoffended” or “returned to bad behavior,” especially in a crime context.
summary.zh: “recidivated”指（尤指在犯罪语境中）再次犯罪或故态复萌。

definition.en: (formal, usually about crime) Returned to bad behavior or reoffended after being punished or after a period of improvement.
definition.zh: （正式用语，多用于犯罪语境）在受到惩罚或一段时间改好之后又故态复萌；再次犯罪。

examples.en: After his release, he recidivated within a year and was arrested again.
examples.zh: 他出狱后不到一年就再次犯罪，并再次被捕。

examples.en: The program aims to reduce the number of people who recidivated after leaving prison.
examples.zh: 该项目旨在减少出狱后再次犯罪的人数。

extraExplanation: “recidivated”是动词recidivate的过去式/过去分词，常见于法律、犯罪学、新闻报道等正式语境；更常用的表达是“reoffended”（再次犯罪）或“went back to crime”（重返犯罪）。
词根来自拉丁语，和名词“recidivism”（再犯；再犯率）同源；在讨论政策、监狱教育、戒毒与社会支持时经常会提到“reduce recidivism”（降低再犯率）。

summary.en: “Recidivating” means relapsing into crime or repeating bad behavior, especially after punishment or an attempt to stop.
summary.zh: “recidivating”指（尤指犯罪者）在受罚或试图改过后又重犯，或再次陷入不良行为。

definition.en: (of a person, especially an offender) relapsing into crime or repeated bad behavior after being punished or trying to stop.
definition.zh: （尤指犯罪者）在受罚或试图改过之后又重犯，或再次陷入不良行为。

examples.en: The program is designed to support people who are recidivating after leaving prison.
examples.zh: 这个项目旨在帮助那些出狱后又重犯的人。

examples.en: He promised to change, but he kept recidivating into the same habits.
examples.zh: 他答应要改变，但还是不断回到同样的旧习惯。

definition.en: Relapsing; showing a return to criminal behavior or an old pattern (used before a noun).
definition.zh: 重犯的；复发的（作定语，放在名词前）。

examples.en: The study tracked recidivating offenders over five years.
examples.zh: 这项研究追踪了重犯者五年的情况。

examples.en: They focused on recidivating cases rather than first-time offenses.
examples.zh: 他们关注的是重犯案例，而不是初犯。

extraExplanation: “recidivating”来自动词 recidivate，常见于犯罪学、法律与新闻语境，用来描述“重返犯罪”。更常见的相关名词是 “recidivism（再犯率/累犯现象）”，例如：reduce recidivism（降低再犯率）。
在日常英语里，人们更常用 “reoffend（再犯）” 或 “relapse（复发/故态复萌）”；“recidivate/recidivating”更正式、偏书面。

summary.en: Recidivation means relapsing into a previous negative state, especially returning to crime after punishment.
summary.zh: Recidivation 指（旧病或恶习的）复发，尤指受罚后再次犯罪。

definition.en: a relapse into a previous bad condition or behavior, especially returning to crime after punishment (similar to “recidivism”).
definition.zh: （旧病或恶习的）复发；尤指受罚后再次犯罪（近义于 recidivism“再犯/累犯倾向”）。

examples.en: The program aims to reduce recidivation among young offenders.
examples.zh: 该项目旨在降低青少年违法者的再犯率。

examples.en: Without support after release, recidivation becomes more likely.
examples.zh: 如果出狱后缺乏支持，再次犯罪就更有可能发生。

extraExplanation: “recidivation”在现代英语中相对少见，更常用的是“recidivism”（再犯/累犯倾向）或“relapse”（复发、故态复萌）。
词源可追溯到拉丁语 recidivus，含义是“再次落回去”。在法律语境里多指再犯；在医学或心理健康语境里可泛指复发。

summary.en: Recidive means to relapse—especially to commit crimes again after punishment; it can also mean the act of reoffending (less common).
summary.zh: recidive 指“复发/再犯”，尤指受惩罚后再次犯罪；也可作名词指再犯行为（较少见）。

definition.en: to relapse into a previous bad behavior, especially to return to criminal activity after being punished
definition.zh: 复发；（尤指）再犯：在受到惩罚或矫治后又回到原来的不良行为或犯罪行为

examples.en: Some offenders recidive within a year of leaving prison.
examples.zh: 有些罪犯出狱后一年内就会再犯。

examples.en: The program aims to help people rebuild their lives so they don’t recidive.
examples.zh: 该项目旨在帮助人们重建生活，避免再次犯罪。

definition.en: a relapse, especially repeated criminal behavior after punishment (less common than recidivism)
definition.zh: 复发；（尤指）再犯：受惩罚后再次犯罪的行为（不如 recidivism 常见）

examples.en: Reducing recidive is a key goal of rehabilitation.
examples.zh: 减少再犯是矫治工作的关键目标。

extraExplanation: “recidive”在英语里相对少见，更常见的是名词“recidivism（再犯率/再犯现象）”和动词“recidivate（再犯/复发）”。在法律、犯罪学、社会工作等语境中最常用。
词源来自拉丁语“recidivus”，本义是“再次落回去/复发”。因此它不仅可用于犯罪语境，也可更广义地表示“旧习复发”，但日常英语里更倾向用“relapse（复发）”或“return to…”来表达。

summary.en: Recidivism means returning to criminal behavior after punishment or release; repeat offending.
summary.zh: Recidivism 指在受惩罚或出狱后再次犯罪的行为，即“再犯/累犯”。

definition.en: the act of returning to criminal behavior after being punished or released from prison; repeated offending
definition.zh: 再犯；累犯；（受惩罚或出狱后）再次犯罪的行为

examples.en: The program aims to reduce recidivism by helping people find jobs after release.
examples.zh: 该项目旨在通过帮助出狱者找工作来降低再犯率。

examples.en: High recidivism rates can suggest that rehabilitation support is not strong enough.
examples.zh: 较高的再犯率可能表明改造与社会支持力度不够。

extraExplanation: “Recidivism”常用于刑事司法与社会政策语境，常与“recidivism rate（再犯率）”“reduce recidivism（降低再犯）”搭配。它通常指再次犯罪，但在更宽泛的学术语境中，也可指“复发/重蹈覆辙”（如成瘾复发），不过最常见仍是“再犯”。
词源来自拉丁语 recidivus，含义是“复发、再度出现”，因此带有“回到旧习惯/旧问题”的感觉。

summary.en: A recidivist is someone who repeatedly returns to crime after punishment; it can also describe behavior that is repeatedly criminal.
summary.zh: recidivist 指屡次再犯、受罚后仍反复犯罪的人；也可形容“有再犯倾向”的行为或特征。

definition.en: a person who repeatedly commits crimes and returns to illegal behavior after being punished
definition.zh: 屡犯者；累犯（指受过惩罚后仍反复犯罪的人）

examples.en: The program aims to reduce the number of recidivists by offering job training.
examples.zh: 该项目通过提供职业培训来减少累犯人数。

examples.en: He was labeled a recidivist after his third arrest.
examples.zh: 他第三次被捕后被贴上“累犯”的标签。

definition.en: tending to relapse into repeated wrongdoing, especially crime
definition.zh: （尤指犯罪）有再犯倾向的；屡教不改的

examples.en: The judge considered his recidivist behavior when deciding the sentence.
examples.zh: 法官在量刑时考虑了他屡次再犯的行为。

examples.en: They discussed how to support recidivist offenders after release.
examples.zh: 他们讨论了如何在出狱后帮助有再犯倾向的违法者。

extraExplanation: “recidivist”常见于新闻报道、法律和犯罪学语境；更中性、学术的相关名词是“recidivism”（再犯率/再犯现象）。日常口语里也可以说“repeat offender”（惯犯/屡犯者）。
词源来自拉丁语 recidivus（意为“复发、再回到原状”），所以除了犯罪语境，在医学或社会问题讨论中也会借用“relapse”（复发）来表达“再次回到不良状态”的概念。

summary.en: “Recidivistic” means related to repeated offending (recidivism), and sometimes repeated relapse into a harmful pattern.
summary.zh: “recidivistic”意为与再犯（累犯）有关的；有时也可引申为反复回到有害模式或坏习惯。

definition.en: Relating to recidivism; describing a person who repeatedly commits crimes or returns to criminal behavior after being punished.
definition.zh: 与“再犯/累犯”（recidivism）有关的；形容一个人多次犯罪或在受罚后再次犯罪。

examples.en: The report focuses on recidivistic offenders who return to prison within two years.
examples.zh: 这份报告重点关注两年内再次入狱的再犯者。

examples.en: Some programs aim to reduce recidivistic behavior by offering job training.
examples.zh: 一些项目通过提供职业培训来减少再犯行为。

definition.en: (Extended use) Showing a repeated return to a bad habit or harmful pattern.
definition.zh: （引申用法）反复回到某种坏习惯或有害模式的。

examples.en: He described his recidivistic tendency to fall back into procrastination during stressful weeks.
examples.zh: 他形容自己在压力大的几周里总会反复回到拖延的倾向。

extraExplanation: “recidivistic”常见于法律、犯罪学、社会工作等正式语境，比“repeat offender（惯犯/再犯者）”更学术、更书面。
词根来自拉丁语 recidivus，含义是“复发、再度出现”；因此也能引申到“旧病复发/坏习惯回潮”的语境，但最核心的用法仍与犯罪再犯相关。

summary.en: Recidivists are people who repeatedly commit crimes, especially after being punished or released from prison.
summary.zh: Recidivists 指屡次犯罪、尤其在受罚或出狱后仍反复犯罪的人（累犯/再犯者）。

definition.en: a person who repeatedly commits crimes and returns to criminal behavior after being punished
definition.zh: 累犯；再犯者（指受罚后仍反复犯罪的人）

examples.en: The program aims to reduce recidivists by offering job training after release.
examples.zh: 该项目通过在出狱后提供职业培训来减少累犯。

examples.en: Some recidivists struggle to find housing, which can increase the chance of reoffending.
examples.zh: 一些再犯者很难找到住房，这会增加再次犯罪的可能性。

extraExplanation: “recidivist”常用于法律、新闻与社会政策语境，带有较强的“犯罪再犯”的含义；日常聊天中更常说“repeat offender”（惯犯/屡犯者）。
词源来自拉丁语 recidivus，意为“再次落回/复发”；因此它也常与“recidivism”（再犯率、再犯现象）一起出现，如“recidivism rate（再犯率）”。
复数形式是 recidivists。发音中重音通常在第二音节：ri-SID-uh-vist。

summary.en: Recidivism means returning to crime or repeating unwanted behavior, often discussed as a “recidivism rate.”
summary.zh: Recidivism 指（尤指犯罪后的）再犯或不良行为的反复，常用于“再犯率”的讨论。

definition.en: the tendency of a person (especially someone convicted of a crime) to relapse into repeated offending or unwanted behavior; the rate of returning to crime after punishment or treatment
definition.zh: （尤指犯罪者）再犯倾向；再犯率；在惩罚或矫治后再次犯罪（或重回不良行为）的情况/比率

examples.en: The program aims to reduce recidivism by offering job training after release.
examples.zh: 该项目通过在出狱后提供职业培训来降低再犯率。

examples.en: Stable housing and counseling can help prevent recidivism.
examples.zh: 稳定的住所和心理辅导有助于预防再犯。

examples.en: The report compared recidivism rates across different states.
examples.zh: 报告比较了不同州的再犯率。

extraExplanation: 你写的“recidivity”在英语里很少用，常见且标准的词是 **recidivism**（再犯/再犯率）。形容词常用 **recidivist**（惯犯；再犯者）或 **recidivistic**（与再犯有关的）。
词源上来自拉丁语 *recidivus*，含义是“复发、重新落入（旧习）”。因此它也偶尔可用于成瘾、疾病等“复发”的语境，但最常见还是刑事司法领域。

summary.en: Recidivous means likely to relapse or reoffend; it’s rare, and recidivist/recidivism are more common.
summary.zh: recidivous 指“易复发/易再犯的”，较少见；更常用 recidivist（累犯/再犯者）与 recidivism（再犯现象、再犯率）。

definition.en: Tending to relapse into a bad habit or to commit crimes again after being punished; showing recidivism.
definition.zh: 有再犯倾向的；（受罚后）易故态复萌或再次犯罪的；体现“再犯/累犯”现象的。

examples.en: The program aims to reduce recidivous behavior among young offenders.
examples.zh: 这个项目旨在减少青少年犯罪者的再犯行为。

examples.en: Some newspapers used recidivous to describe repeat offenders, but recidivist is more common.
examples.zh: 有些报纸会用 recidivous 来形容屡次犯罪者，但更常见的说法是 recidivist。

extraExplanation: recidivous 很少见，更常用的相关词是 recidivism（n. 再犯/累犯现象）和 recidivist（n./adj. 累犯；再犯的）。在法律、犯罪学或社会政策语境中常会讨论“降低 recidivism（降低再犯率）”。
词源来自拉丁语 recidivus，含义是“复发、再度发生”。因此它也可比喻用于坏习惯或问题的“复发”，不一定只指犯罪，但最常见仍是与犯罪再犯相关的语境。

summary.en: “recip” is an informal abbreviation for “recipe,” and in math/science it can also mean “reciprocal” (1 divided by a number).
summary.zh: “recip”常作为“recipe（食谱）”的非正式缩写；在数学/理科语境中也可指“reciprocal（倒数）”。

definition.en: Informal abbreviation (esp. in notes, texts, or online) for “recipe.”
definition.zh: （非正式缩写，常见于笔记、短信或网络）“recipe（食谱；做法）”的缩写。

examples.en: Can you send me the recip for that soup?
examples.zh: 你能把那道汤的食谱（recip）发我吗？

examples.en: I saved the recip in my phone.
examples.zh: 我把食谱（recip）存到手机里了。

definition.en: Abbreviation (common in math/science notes) for “reciprocal,” meaning “the multiplicative inverse” (1 divided by a number).
definition.zh: （数学/理科笔记常见缩写）“reciprocal（倒数）”的缩写，指“乘法逆元”，即 1 除以某个数。

examples.en: The recip of 4 is 1/4.
examples.zh: 4 的倒数（recip）是 1/4。

examples.en: Take the recip to simplify the fraction.
examples.zh: 取倒数（recip）来化简分数。

extraExplanation: “recip”不是很标准的书面缩写，更常见于随手记笔记或口语化文本。正式写作里建议写全：recipe / reciprocal。
在数学里，“reciprocal”对应中文“倒数”。例如 a 的倒数是 1/a（a ≠ 0）。

summary.en: Recipe most commonly means cooking instructions; it can also mean a reliable method that leads to a result (often in “a recipe for …”).
summary.zh: recipe 最常指“食谱/菜谱”；也可比喻为“导致某种结果的方法/配方”，常见于 “a recipe for …”。

definition.en: A set of instructions for cooking a particular dish, including the ingredients and steps.
definition.zh: （烹饪）食谱；菜谱：写明食材与步骤的一套做菜说明。

examples.en: This recipe calls for two eggs and a cup of flour.
examples.zh: 这份食谱需要两个鸡蛋和一杯面粉。

examples.en: I found an easy pasta recipe online.
examples.zh: 我在网上找到一个简单的意大利面食谱。

definition.en: A method or plan for achieving a particular result (often used figuratively).
definition.zh: （比喻）方法；诀窍；“成功/麻烦的配方”：达成某种结果的一套做法。

examples.en: Regular sleep and exercise can be a recipe for better health.
examples.zh: 规律睡眠和运动可以是更健康的“配方”。

examples.en: Leaving everything until the last minute is a recipe for disaster.
examples.zh: 把事情都拖到最后一刻是“自找麻烦的配方”。

extraExplanation: 在英语里，recipe 很常用于固定搭配 “a recipe for + 结果”，多用于强调某种做法几乎必然导致某个结果，既可正面（a recipe for success/health），也常见负面（a recipe for disaster/trouble）。
词源上，recipe 来自拉丁语“取用/拿来”（类似处方开头的用语），所以它也和“处方（prescription）”有历史上的关联；现代英语中最常见还是“食谱”。

summary.en: Recipere is a Latin verb meaning “to receive” or “to take back,” mostly used in scholarly or motto contexts.
summary.zh: recipere 是拉丁语动词，意为“接收”或“取回”，多用于学术或格言语境。

definition.en: (Latin) to take back; to receive; to accept. Often seen in academic, legal, or motto contexts rather than everyday English.
definition.zh: （拉丁语）取回；接收；接受。多见于学术、法律或格言语境，不常用于日常英语。

examples.en: In Latin class, we learned that recipere can mean “to receive” or “to take back.”
examples.zh: 在拉丁语课上，我们学到 recipere 可以表示“接收”或“取回”。

examples.en: Some university mottos use Latin verbs like recipere to express ideas such as accepting knowledge or responsibility.
examples.zh: 一些大学校训会用像 recipere 这样的拉丁动词，表达“接纳知识”或“承担责任”等含义。

extraExplanation:
recipere 是拉丁语不定式，来自 re-（“回、再”）+ capere（“抓、拿”）。它和英语 receive、receipt、recipe 都有词源关联：
- receive（接收）强调“收到/接受”；
- receipt（收据）原义与“收到”有关；
- recipe（食谱）源自拉丁语处方/指令开头的“Recipe”（意为“取/拿”），后来转指“配方、做法”。

summary.en: “Recipes” most commonly means cooking instructions; it can also mean a method or formula for achieving a result.
summary.zh: “recipes”最常指“食谱/做法”；也可引申指“方法、诀窍、公式”。

definition.en: instructions for making a particular dish or drink, including the ingredients and steps (plural of “recipe”).
definition.zh: （复数）食谱；烹饪/调饮的做法说明，包含食材与步骤。

examples.en: I saved a few easy recipes for busy weeknights.
examples.zh: 我存了几个简单的食谱，适合工作日晚上忙的时候做。

examples.en: This website has recipes for soups, salads, and desserts.
examples.zh: 这个网站有汤、沙拉和甜点的食谱。

examples.en: Could you share your family recipes?
examples.zh: 你能分享一下你家的祖传食谱吗？

definition.en: methods or “formulas” for doing something successfully (often used outside cooking).
definition.zh: （引申）诀窍；方法；“成功公式”（常用于烹饪以外的语境）。

examples.en: The book offers simple recipes for better communication at work.
examples.zh: 这本书提供了一些改善职场沟通的简单方法。

examples.en: There’s no single recipe for happiness.
examples.zh: 幸福没有唯一的公式。

extraExplanation: “recipe”来自拉丁语 recipe，原意是“拿来/取用（Take）”，过去常用于药方开头，表示“取某某成分”。因此在英语里，recipe 既能指菜谱，也能指“配方/方法”。
在英文中更常说“a recipe for + 名词”（如 a recipe for success/disaster），表示“导致某种结果的方式/原因”。

summary.en: A rectangle is a four-sided shape with four right angles; it can also mean a rectangular area or object.
summary.zh: rectangle 指“长方形”，即四个角都是直角的四边形；也可指长方形的区域或物体。

definition.en: a flat (2D) shape with four right angles; opposite sides are equal and parallel
definition.zh: 长方形；四个角都是直角的平面图形，对边相等且平行

examples.en: Draw a rectangle that is 6 cm long and 3 cm wide.
examples.zh: 画一个长 6 厘米、宽 3 厘米的长方形。

examples.en: The window is a tall rectangle.
examples.zh: 这扇窗户是一个很高的长方形。

definition.en: a rectangular area or object (something shaped like a rectangle)
definition.zh: 矩形区域；长方形物体

examples.en: The garden is a rectangle behind the house.
examples.zh: 房子后面的花园是一块长方形的区域。

examples.en: He folded the paper into a neat rectangle.
examples.zh: 他把纸折成了一个整齐的长方形。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 “recipiangle” 不是常见英语单词，最可能是拼写错误：常见目标词是 “rectangle”（长方形）。
“rectangle” 来自拉丁语词根，rect- 表示“直的/正确的”，-angle 表示“角”，合起来就是“直角的四边形”。

summary.en: “Recipiatur” is a Latin term used in older legal writing meaning “let it be received/accepted.”
summary.zh: “recipiatur”是较旧的法律拉丁语用语，表示“准予接纳/采纳”。

definition.en: A Latin legal term meaning “let it be received” or “it should be accepted,” used historically in court pleadings to indicate that something (a plea, evidence, or an argument) is admitted/accepted by the court.
definition.zh: 拉丁语法律术语，意为“准予收受/准予采纳/应被接受”，历史上用于法庭诉状或程序用语中，表示某项主张、抗辩或证据被法院接纳。

examples.en: The old record notes “recipiatur,” meaning the court accepted the filing.
examples.zh: 旧案卷上写着“recipiatur”，表示法院已接纳该项提交材料。

examples.en: In some historical pleadings, a judge might write “recipiatur” to allow a plea to be entered.
examples.zh: 在一些历史诉状中，法官可能写“recipiatur”，表示允许该抗辩被正式记入。

extraExplanation: 这是拉丁语动词 recipere（接收、收受、接受）的被动虚拟式（命令/愿望用法），直译接近“让它被接收”。常见于较早期的英美法律文书与法庭笔记中；现代英语法律写作通常直接用 “admitted/accepted/received/allowed”。

summary.en: Recipience means the state of being a recipient (receiving something). It is a rare, formal word.
summary.zh: Recipience 指“作为接受者、接收某物的状态/性质”，用法偏正式且较少见。

definition.en: the state or quality of being a recipient; the ability or role of receiving something
definition.zh: 接受（某物）的状态或性质；作为接受者的能力或角色

examples.en: Her recipience of the award surprised no one.
examples.zh: 她获得这个奖项并不让人意外。

examples.en: The study focused on recipience of information in online classrooms.
examples.zh: 这项研究关注在线课堂中信息的接收情况。

extraExplanation: “recipience”是比较少见、偏正式的名词，来自“recipient（接受者）”。日常英语里更常用“receipt（收到/收据）”或“receiving（接收）”。
注意拼写：很多人想写的是“recipient（接受者）”或“receipt（收到/收据）”，而不是“recipience”。

summary.en: Recipiency means the state of receiving something or being a recipient, mainly in formal contexts.
summary.zh: Recipiency 指“受领/接受的状态”或“作为接受者的身份”，多见于正式语境。

definition.en: the state or condition of being a recipient; the act of receiving something (often used in formal or academic writing).
definition.zh: 接受者的身份或状态；接受（某物）的行为（多用于正式或学术语境）。

examples.en: Scholarship recipiency can reduce the financial pressure on students.
examples.zh: 获得奖学金的资格（奖学金受领状态）可以减轻学生的经济压力。

examples.en: The study examined how aid recipiency affects children’s health outcomes.
examples.zh: 这项研究考察了援助受领情况如何影响儿童的健康结果。

examples.en: Her recipiency of the award was announced at the ceremony.
examples.zh: 在典礼上宣布了她获奖（受领该奖项）的消息。

extraExplanation: “recipiency”较少用于日常口语，更常见的是“receipt”（收到、收据）或用“being a recipient / receiving”来表达。它在社会科学、政策研究里常见，比如“benefit recipiency（福利受领）”“aid recipiency（援助受领）”。

summary.en: A recipient is a person or organization that receives something; it can also describe the receiving side.
summary.zh: recipient 指“接收者/收受者”，也可作形容词表示“接受方的”。

definition.en: a person or organization that receives something (a gift, money, a message, an award, etc.)
definition.zh: 接收者；收受者（人或机构，收到礼物、钱、信息、奖项等）

examples.en: Who is the recipient of this package?
examples.zh: 这个包裹的收件人是谁？

examples.en: She was the recipient of a scholarship.
examples.zh: 她获得了奖学金。

examples.en: Please write the recipient’s name clearly on the envelope.
examples.zh: 请把收件人的名字清楚地写在信封上。

definition.en: receiving something
definition.zh: 接受（某物）的；作为接受方的

examples.en: The recipient country agreed to the new aid program.
examples.zh: 受援国同意了新的援助项目。

examples.en: Recipient details must match your ID.
examples.zh: 收款/收件信息必须与您的身份证件一致。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“recipiend”很可能是拼写错误；正确拼写通常是 **recipient**。
词根提示：**re-**（向后/回）+ **cap**（拿、取，见 *receive*）相关，整体有“接收、领取”的意思。常见搭配有 *recipient of*（……的获得者/接受者）、*intended recipient*（预定收件人）。

summary.en: Recipiendary is a rare formal word meaning a recipient, or something related to receiving.
summary.zh: recipiendary 是一个较少见的正式用词，表示“接受者/受领者”，也可作形容词表示“与接受有关的”。

definition.en: A person or group that receives something (such as an award, money, or a letter); a recipient.
definition.zh: 接受者；领受者（如奖项、款项或信件的接收人/团体）。

examples.en: She was the recipiendary of a scholarship that covered her tuition.
examples.zh: 她是一个奖学金的受领者，这笔奖学金支付了她的学费。

examples.en: The recipiendary of the donation asked to remain anonymous.
examples.zh: 这笔捐款的受领者要求匿名。

definition.en: Related to receiving something; serving as a receiver (rare in modern English).
definition.zh: 与接受有关的；作为接受方的（现代英语中较少见）。

examples.en: The letter used formal language suitable for a recipiendary institution.
examples.zh: 这封信使用了适合受领机构的正式措辞。

examples.en: Some older legal texts mention recipiendary rights.
examples.zh: 一些较旧的法律文本提到“受领方的权利”。

extraExplanation: “recipiendary”较为少见、带书面/法律色彩；日常英语更常用“recipient”。
词源与拉丁语 recipere（接受、领受）有关，同源常见词包括“receive”“reception”。
在较正式的语境里，它有时强调“作为受领一方的身份/角色”，比“recipient”更“文书化”。

summary.en: A rare Latin-derived noun meaning “something that must be received/accepted,” sometimes used in older legal contexts.
summary.zh: 一个源自拉丁语、较罕见的名词，意为“必须接收/接受之物”，有时用于较旧的法律语境。

definition.en: (Rare, formal) something that is to be received or accepted; a required thing to be taken in.
definition.zh: （罕见、正式）应当被接收或接受之物；必须收取/接纳的事项。

examples.en: The committee treated the signed letter as a recipiendum before the vote could proceed.
examples.zh: 委员会把这封已签署的信视为投票前必须接收的文件。

examples.en: In older writing, the term can refer to anything that must be received into a record.
examples.zh: 在较早的写法中，这个词可指必须被收录进档案的任何内容。

definition.en: (Law, historical; especially in older British/Scots usage) a matter or document that must be received/entered as part of a legal process.
definition.zh: （法律、历史用语；尤见于较旧的英式/苏格兰用法）法律程序中必须接收或登记的事项/文件。

examples.en: The clerk noted the filing as the recipiendum required by procedure.
examples.zh: 书记员将该提交记录为程序所要求的“必须接收之件”。

extraExplanation: recipiendum 来自拉丁语 recipere（“接收、收取、接受”）。-endum 是一种表示“应当……/必须……”的形式，因此 recipiendum 字面意思接近“应当被接收之物”。
它在现代英语里非常少见，多见于古典学、历史文献或较旧的法律语境。日常英语通常用 thing to be received / required document / item to be accepted 等表达。

summary.en: A recipient is the person or organization that receives something, especially mail, money, awards, or donations.
summary.zh: recipient 指“接收者/受领者”，常用于邮件、款项、奖项或捐赠等语境。

definition.en: a person or organization that receives something (such as a gift, money, a message, or an organ transplant).
definition.zh: 接收者；受领者（个人或机构，接收礼物、钱款、信息或器官移植等）。

examples.en: Please write the recipient’s name clearly on the package.
examples.zh: 请把收件人的名字清楚地写在包裹上。

examples.en: The scholarship recipient thanked the donors in a short speech.
examples.zh: 奖学金获得者在简短的致辞中感谢了捐赠者。

examples.en: Hospitals must protect the privacy of transplant recipients.
examples.zh: 医院必须保护器官移植受者的隐私。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：email recipient（邮件收件人）、intended recipient（预定/目标收件人）、recipient address（收件地址）、award recipient（获奖者）、transplant recipient（移植受者）。
易混词对比：recipient 强调“接收的一方”；receiver 也可指接收者，但更常用于“接收装置/接收器”（如 radio receiver）。

summary.en: *recipientem* is a Latin form meaning “(to) the recipient / the one receiving,” often seen in formal Latin texts.
summary.zh: *recipientem* 是拉丁语词形，表示“收受者／接受者（作为受词）”，常见于正式拉丁文本中。

definition.en: A Latin word form meaning “recipient” or “the one receiving” (accusative singular of *recipiens*, from *recipere* “to receive”). It may appear in legal, medical, or church Latin documents.
definition.zh: 拉丁语词形，意思是“收受者／接受者”（*recipiens* 的宾格单数，源自 *recipere*“接受、收取”）。常见于法律、医学或教会拉丁文文本中。

examples.en: The Latin phrase *ad recipientem* means “to the recipient.”
examples.zh: 拉丁短语 *ad recipientem* 的意思是“给收受者／交给接受者”。

examples.en: In a formal document, you might see *donum recipientem* to describe “the person receiving a gift.”
examples.zh: 在正式文件里，你可能会看到 *donum recipientem* 来描述“接受礼物的人”。

extraExplanation: *recipientem* 不是常见英语单词，而是拉丁语的语法形态（宾格），通常用于表示动作的承受对象（“把某物给谁／对谁”）。如果你要查英语表达，最接近的是 **recipient**（收件人、受赠人、受益人等）。

summary.en: “Recipients” means the people or groups who receive something, especially emails, messages, gifts, money, or awards.
summary.zh: “recipients”指接收某物的人或机构，常用于邮件、信息、礼物、款项或奖项等语境。

definition.en: People or organizations that receive something (such as a gift, message, email, money, or an award).
definition.zh: 接收者；收件人；受赠者（指收到礼物、信息、邮件、款项或奖项的人或机构）。

examples.en: All recipients will receive a confirmation email within 24 hours.
examples.zh: 所有收件人将在24小时内收到确认邮件。

examples.en: The aid was distributed to the intended recipients in the rural areas.
examples.zh: 援助物资被分发给农村地区的目标受援者。

examples.en: Please check the recipients before you send the message.
examples.zh: 发送消息前请检查收件人。

extraExplanation: “Recipients”是名词复数，单数是“recipient”。在邮件/短信语境里最常见，相当于“收件人”。在更正式的场合也可指“受赠者/受益人”（如奖学金recipient、援助recipient）。
常见搭配：email recipients（邮件收件人）、intended recipients（预期接收者/目标对象）、recipients of an award（获奖者）。
“recipient”比“receiver”更正式，强调“被给予/被授予”的一方；“receiver”更口语，常指“接收信号/电话的人或设备”。

summary.en: “Recipiomotor” is a rare technical adjective meaning “involving reciprocal muscle action (one contracts while the opposite relaxes).”
summary.zh: “recipiomotor”是很少见的专业形容词，指“互惠性肌肉运动：一方收缩、对抗方放松”。

definition.en: (rare, technical) Relating to **reciprocal motor action**, especially in physiology: when one muscle group contracts while the opposing (antagonist) muscle group relaxes.
definition.zh: （罕见、专业用语）与**互惠性运动/互抑性运动**有关，尤指生理学中：一组肌肉收缩时，对抗肌群同时放松。

examples.en: Walking uses a recipiomotor pattern: as you bend one knee, the opposing muscles relax to allow the movement.
examples.zh: 走路会用到一种“recipiomotor（互惠性运动）”模式：当你屈膝时，对抗肌会放松以让动作顺利完成。

examples.en: The doctor explained that some reflexes depend on recipiomotor coordination between flexors and extensors.
examples.zh: 医生解释说，有些反射依赖屈肌与伸肌之间的 recipiomotor（互惠性）协调。

extraExplanation: “recipiomotor”在现代英语里非常少见，多见于较旧的生理学/神经学语境中。很多时候作者更常用的写法是 **reciprocal motor**（互惠性运动）或 **reciprocal innervation**（互惠神经支配）。
如果你是在论文、教材或笔记里看到它，也有可能是拼写变体或误写；你可以对照上下文是否在讲“对抗肌放松、主动肌收缩”的机制。

summary.en: Reciprocable means “able to be returned or exchanged; mutual,” often used in formal contexts.
summary.zh: reciprocable 意为“可回报的、可互相交换的；互惠的”，多用于较正式语境。

definition.en: Able to be given, felt, or done in return; mutual.
definition.zh: 可回报的；可互相交换的；互惠的。

examples.en: Trust should be reciprocable in a healthy relationship.
examples.zh: 在健康的关系中，信任应该是可以互相给予的。

examples.en: They hoped their kindness would be reciprocable, not one-sided.
examples.zh: 他们希望自己的善意能得到回报，而不是单方面付出。

definition.en: (More formal) Able to be exchanged between two sides, such as rights, duties, or agreements.
definition.zh: （较正式）可相互交换的（如权利、义务或协议）。

examples.en: The two countries discussed reciprocable trade benefits.
examples.zh: 两国讨论了可互惠的贸易利益。

extraExplanation: “reciprocable”来自“reciprocate（回报；互换）”。日常英语里更常用的表达是“reciprocal（互惠的）”或直接用动词“reciprocate”。例如：“a reciprocal agreement（互惠协议）”、“to reciprocate a favor（回报一个人情）”。
语体提示：这个词偏书面/正式，常见于法律、政策、学术或较正式的评论中；口语里用“mutual（相互的）”或“give-and-take（有来有往）”更自然。

summary.en: Reciprocal means mutual or equally shared; in math it also means “reciprocal,” the inverse like 1/x.
summary.zh: reciprocal 常指“相互的、互惠的”；在数学中指“倒数/乘法逆元”（如 1/x）。

definition.en: (Of actions, feelings, or relationships) shared and given back equally by both sides; mutual.
definition.zh: （指行为、感情或关系）双方相互给予、对等回报的；互惠的；相互的。

examples.en: Their respect is reciprocal—they listen to each other and value each other’s ideas.
examples.zh: 他们的尊重是相互的——彼此倾听，也重视对方的想法。

examples.en: We agreed to a reciprocal arrangement: I help you this week, and you help me next week.
examples.zh: 我们同意了一个互惠安排：这周我帮你，下周你帮我。

definition.en: A mathematical expression showing the multiplicative inverse of a number (for example, the reciprocal of 5 is 1/5).
definition.zh: （数学）倒数；乘法逆元（例如 5 的倒数是 1/5）。

examples.en: To divide by a fraction, you can multiply by its reciprocal.
examples.zh: 用分数做除法时，可以乘以它的倒数。

examples.en: The reciprocal of 0.25 is 4.
examples.zh: 0.25 的倒数是 4。

extraExplanation: 词源来自拉丁语 reciprocus，含义是“来回的、交替回返的”，所以 reciprocal 常强调“你来我往、彼此对应”。
在日常英语里更常用 mutual 来表达“相互的”（mutual friends 共同的朋友），而 reciprocal 更强调“对等回报/互惠”（reciprocal agreement 互惠协议）。
常见搭配：reciprocal relationship（互惠关系）、reciprocal benefits（互惠利益）、reciprocal visits（互访）、reciprocal altruism（互惠利他，常见于科普/社会科学语境）。

summary.en: “Reciprocality” means mutual exchange or equal give-and-take, especially in relationships or formal agreements.
summary.zh: “reciprocality”指互惠性/相互性，即双方对等的给予与回报，常用于人际关系或正式协议语境。

definition.en: a relationship in which two people, groups, or actions affect each other equally, with mutual exchange or return
definition.zh: 互惠性；相互性（指双方彼此影响、交换或回报的关系）

examples.en: Trust grows through reciprocality: when one person is honest, the other responds with honesty too.
examples.zh: 信任常通过互惠性建立：当一个人诚实，另一个人也会以诚实回应。

examples.en: In healthy friendships, there is reciprocality in support and listening.
examples.zh: 在健康的友谊中，支持与倾听往往是相互的（具有互惠性）。

definition.en: the quality of being reciprocal in rights, duties, or benefits (often used in law, politics, and international relations)
definition.zh: （法律/政治/国际关系中）互惠原则；对等性（指权利、义务或利益上的相互给予）

examples.en: The agreement is based on reciprocality: both countries reduce tariffs in the same way.
examples.zh: 该协议以互惠原则为基础：两国以相同方式降低关税。

examples.en: Some visas depend on reciprocality between the two governments.
examples.zh: 有些签证政策取决于两国政府之间的互惠关系。

extraExplanation: “reciprocality”来自形容词“reciprocal”（相互的、互惠的）。日常英语里更常见的名词是“reciprocity”（互惠、互相性），意思几乎相同；“reciprocality”偏学术或较少见。
常见搭配：reciprocity/reciprocality in relationships（关系中的互惠）、principle of reciprocity（互惠原则）、mutual exchange（相互交换）。

summary.en: “Reciprocalize” means to make something mutual or two-way; in linguistics, to form an “each other” meaning.
summary.zh: “reciprocalize”指使某事变成相互/互惠的；在语言学中指使结构带有“彼此（each other）”的意义。

definition.en: to make something reciprocal; to create a mutual or two-way relationship, exchange, or action
definition.zh: 使某事变成互惠/相互的；让关系、交换或行为变成双向的

examples.en: The two companies tried to reciprocalize their partnership by sharing research and profits.
examples.zh: 两家公司试图通过共享研发与利润，让合作变成互惠关系。

examples.en: A fair system should reciprocalize responsibilities and benefits for everyone involved.
examples.zh: 一个公平的制度应当让所有参与者的责任与利益相互对应、互惠。

definition.en: (linguistics) to change a verb or construction so the participants act on each other ("each other" meaning)
definition.zh: （语言学）使动词或结构带有“彼此/相互”的意义（类似“each other”）

examples.en: Some languages can reciprocalize a verb with a special affix, so “see” becomes “see each other.”
examples.zh: 有些语言可以用特定词缀把动词“相互化”，让“see（看见）”变成“see each other（互相看见）”。

examples.en: The grammar lesson explained how certain markers reciprocalize actions in the sentence.
examples.zh: 语法课讲解了某些标记如何让句子里的动作呈现“相互进行”的含义。

extraExplanation: “reciprocalize”在日常英语里非常少见，更常用的表达是 make something reciprocal / establish reciprocity / mutualize（在某些语境）或 use reciprocal forms（语言学语境）。
构词上：reciprocal（互惠的、相互的）+ -ize（使……化）。因此它通常带“把……变成某种性质”的意思，语气偏正式或学术。

summary.en: “Reciprocally” means “mutually; in a give-and-take way,” and sometimes “in a corresponding/opposite way.”
summary.zh: “reciprocally”表示“相互地、互惠地”，有时也指“对应地/相反地（相互关联）”。

definition.en: In a mutual way—each person or thing does the same (or a corresponding) action to the other.
definition.zh: 相互地；互惠地——双方（或多方）彼此对对方做同样或对应的事情。

examples.en: They agreed to help each other reciprocally during the busy season.
examples.zh: 他们同意在旺季互相帮助。

examples.en: In a healthy relationship, respect should be given reciprocally.
examples.zh: 在健康的关系中，尊重应该是相互给予的。

examples.en: The two countries reduced tariffs reciprocally.
examples.zh: 两国互相下调了关税。

definition.en: In a corresponding or opposite way (often describing linked forces, roles, or positions).
definition.zh: 对应地；相反地（常用于描述彼此关联的力、角色或位置）。

examples.en: As stress increases, sleep quality often decreases reciprocally.
examples.zh: 压力增加时，睡眠质量往往会相应下降。

examples.en: The gears turn reciprocally, so one gear’s movement affects the other.
examples.zh: 齿轮相互联动，所以一个齿轮的运动会影响另一个。

extraExplanation: “reciprocally”来自“reciprocal（相互的、互惠的）”，核心概念是“你对我/我对你”的互相性。日常表达里更常见的替换说法有“each other / mutually”。
常见搭配：reciprocally benefit（互利）、reciprocally agree（互相同意）、reciprocally related（相互关联）。
注意区分：reciprocally（强调双方互相作用）≠ respectively（分别地，强调一一对应但不一定互相影响）。

summary.en: Reciprocalness means the quality of being mutual or two-way—each side gives, affects, or responds to the other.
summary.zh: Reciprocalness 指“互惠、相互、双向”的特质——双方彼此给予、影响或回应。

definition.en: the quality of being reciprocal; mutual exchange or two-way relationship
definition.zh: 互惠性；互相的特质；双向关系

examples.en: Trust grows when there is reciprocalness in a friendship—both people give and receive support.
examples.zh: 当友谊中有互惠性时，信任会增长——双方都会给予并接受支持。

examples.en: Good teamwork depends on reciprocalness: you help others, and they help you when you need it.
examples.zh: 良好的团队合作依赖互惠性：你帮助别人，别人也会在你需要时帮助你。

extraExplanation: “reciprocalness”在现代英语里不算常见，更常用的名词是“reciprocity”（互惠、互相性）或“mutuality”（相互性）。在正式写作中，用“reciprocity”通常更自然。
词根提示：reciprocal 来自拉丁语 reciprocus，含“来回、相互”的意思，因此这个词强调“双方都朝对方方向发生”的关系（如互相帮助、互相影响）。

summary.en: “Reciprocals” can mean mutual returns/exchanges, or (in math) multiplicative inverses (numbers that multiply to 1).
summary.zh: “Reciprocals”既可指互惠的回报/交换，也可指（数学）倒数（相乘得 1 的数）。

definition.en: Plural of “reciprocal”: a thing that is given, felt, or done in return; a mutual exchange.
definition.zh: “reciprocal”的复数：回报之物；互相给予、互相交换的事物。

examples.en: Good friends often do favors and expect reciprocals over time.
examples.zh: 好朋友常常互相帮忙，并在时间里得到回报。
