definition.en: sending goods again under a new shipping order, often changing the consignee (receiver) or destination
definition.zh: （货运/物流中）重新托运；把货物按新的运输指令再次发运，常伴随更改收货人或目的地

examples.en: Because the buyer changed warehouses, the company is reconsigning the shipment to a new address.
examples.zh: 因为买家更换了仓库，公司正在把这批货重新托运到新的地址。

examples.en: The carrier charged an extra fee for reconsigning the containers at the last minute.
examples.zh: 承运人对临时重新托运这些集装箱收取了额外费用。

definition.en: figuratively, assigning or sending someone or something again to a different place or role
definition.zh: （引申）把某人或某物再次安排/派往别处或重新分配到新的角色

examples.en: After the reorganization, she is reconsigning staff to different projects.
examples.zh: 重组之后，她正在把员工重新分配到不同的项目中。

extraExplanation: “reconsign”常见于航运、货代与仓储文件（如提单、运单）。实际操作里可能涉及改收货人、改目的港、改交付指令等，因此通常会产生“reconsignment fee（改派/改址费）”。

summary.en: Reconsignment is changing the consignee or destination of goods after shipment, often while the goods are already in transit.
summary.zh: reconsignment 指货物发运后（常在运输途中）变更收货人或目的地的改运/改寄操作。

definition.en: The act of sending goods to a new consignee or a different destination after they have already been shipped.
definition.zh: （货物）在已发运后改发给新的收货人或改运到其他目的地的行为；改寄/改运。

examples.en: Due to the port strike, the exporter requested reconsignment to a different port.
examples.zh: 由于港口罢工，出口商要求将货物改运到另一个港口。

examples.en: The carrier charged an extra fee for reconsignment after the shipment had left the warehouse.
examples.zh: 货物离开仓库后，承运人对改运收取了额外费用。

definition.en: A logistics service or instruction that changes the consignee, route, or final delivery point of a shipment in transit.
definition.zh: （物流服务/指令）在运输途中变更收货人、路线或最终交付地点的操作。

examples.en: Reconsignment is available if you need to change the delivery address mid-route.
examples.zh: 如果你需要在途中更改收货地址，可以申请改运服务。

examples.en: Please submit a written reconsignment request with the new consignee information.
examples.zh: 请提交书面改运申请，并提供新的收货人信息。

extraExplanation: 这是一个偏“物流/航运/外贸”领域的词，常见于提单（bill of lading）、运输条款和承运人收费项目中。一般意味着货物已在运输链路中，需要“改收货人/改目的地/改路线”，因此可能涉及额外费用、时效变化和文件更新。
相关词：consignee（收货人）、consignor（发货人）、reroute（改道）、redirect（改投递）。注意与 reshipment（重新发货）不同：reconsignment 通常是在原运输基础上“改指示/改交付”。

summary.en: “Reconsign(s)” means to ship or consign goods again, often rerouting them to a different person or place.
summary.zh: “reconsign(s)”指把货物再次托运/改发，常用于将货转给不同收货人或改到新目的地。

definition.en: to consign (send or entrust goods) again, especially by shipping them to a new consignee or destination
definition.zh: 再托运；再次交付承运（尤指把货物重新发运到新的收货人或目的地）

examples.en: The warehouse reconsigns the package if the original delivery address is incorrect.
examples.zh: 如果原来的投递地址不正确，仓库会把包裹重新托运。

examples.en: After the buyer canceled the order, the supplier reconsigned the shipment to another customer.
examples.zh: 买家取消订单后，供应商把这批货重新托运给另一位客户。

definition.en: (of a company or carrier) to send back and then forward goods again as part of rerouting or redelivery
definition.zh: （公司或承运方）将货物退回后再转运（用于改道或重新投递）

examples.en: The carrier reconsigned the freight through a different port to avoid delays.
examples.zh: 承运方为避免延误，将货物改经另一个港口重新转运。

extraExplanation: “reconsign”常见于物流/航运/仓储文件与客服沟通中；意思不是“重新签收”，而是“重新托运/改发/转运”。
你输入的“reconsigns”是第三人称单数（He/She/It reconsigns）。常见形式还有：reconsign（原形）、reconsigned（过去式/过去分词）、reconsigning（现在分词）。

summary.en: Reconsole means to comfort someone again, giving renewed consolation.
summary.zh: reconsole 指“再次安慰”，让人重新获得安慰。

definition.en: to comfort or console again; to give someone renewed comfort after they have become sad or worried again
definition.zh: 再次安慰；使（某人）重新得到安慰（在又一次难过或担心之后）

examples.en: After the bad news, she tried to reconsol e her friend with a calm voice and a warm drink.
examples.zh: 听到坏消息后，她用平静的语气和一杯热饮再次安慰朋友。

examples.en: He was reconsoled by letters from home when he started to lose hope.
examples.zh: 当他开始失去希望时，家里的来信让他重新得到安慰。

extraExplanation: “reconsole”在现代英语中比较少见，语气偏文学或古旧；日常更常用“console again / comfort again”或“reassure”。
前缀“re-”表示“再、重新”，加在“console（安慰）”前面，强调“第二次或反复安慰”的动作。

summary.en: “Reconsoled” means comforted someone again.
summary.zh: “Reconsoled”表示“再次安慰/再次劝慰”。

definition.en: to comfort someone again after they become upset or worried once more; to console a second time
definition.zh: 在对方再次难过或担心时，再次安慰、再次劝慰

examples.en: She cried again when she read the letter, and her friend reconsoled her.
examples.zh: 她读到那封信又哭了起来，朋友再次安慰了她。

examples.en: The coach reconsoled the team after another disappointing loss.
examples.zh: 又一次令人失望的失利后，教练再次安慰了队员们。

extraExplanation: “reconsoled”来自前缀 re-（再次）+ consoled（安慰了）。它在日常英语里不算常见；更自然的说法常是“consoled … again / comforted … again”。
形式上，“reconsoled”通常是动词 reconsole 的过去式/过去分词，用来强调“重复发生的安慰”。

summary.en: Reconsolidate means to consolidate again—either to reorganize and strengthen something, or (in psychology) to restabilize a recalled memory.
summary.zh: Reconsolidate 指“再次巩固/重新整合”；也可指（心理学）记忆在被唤起后再次稳定的“记忆再巩固”。

definition.en: to consolidate again; to bring something back together into a stronger or more unified form
definition.zh: 再次巩固；重新整合使其更稳固或更统一

examples.en: After the merger, the company had to reconsolidate its teams and budgets.
examples.zh: 并购之后，公司不得不重新整合团队和预算。

examples.en: We reconsolidated our notes into one clear study guide.
examples.zh: 我们把笔记重新整理成一份清晰的复习资料。

definition.en: (psychology) to stabilize a memory again after it has been recalled and updated
definition.zh: （心理学）记忆在被唤起并可能被更新后，再次被稳定/巩固的过程

examples.en: Therapists may help patients reconsolidate traumatic memories in a safer way.
examples.zh: 治疗师可能帮助来访者以更安全的方式重新巩固创伤记忆。

examples.en: When you recall an event, the brain can reconsolidate the memory with new details.
examples.zh: 当你回忆一件事时，大脑可能会把新细节一起“重新巩固”进记忆里。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，“consolidate”表示“巩固、合并、整合”。因此 reconsolidate 强调“已经整合过一次，但后来分散/变化了，于是再整合一次”。
在心理学与神经科学中，“记忆再巩固（memory reconsolidation）”是一个常见术语：记忆被提取出来后会短暂变得“不稳定”，随后可能带着新信息再次被“存回去”。

summary.en: Reconsolidated means “combined and made strong/stable again,” used for organizations, finances, or (in science) memories after recall.
summary.zh: reconsolidated 表示“再次合并并巩固/稳定”，常用于组织整合、金融合并，或（科研中）记忆在唤起后的再巩固。

definition.en: brought together again into a single, stronger, or more organized whole (often after being divided or weakened).
definition.zh: （在分散或削弱之后）再次合并并巩固成一个更统一、更强或更有组织的整体。

examples.en: After the merger, the company’s departments were reconsolidated into one operations team.
examples.zh: 并购后，公司各部门被重新整合并巩固为一个运营团队。

examples.en: The general reconsolidated the troops near the capital before moving forward.
examples.zh: 将军在继续推进前，把部队在首都附近重新集结并巩固。

definition.en: combined again into one financial account or arrangement, especially to simplify payments or reduce risk (e.g., debt, loans, or funds).
definition.zh: （金融）把资金或债务等再次合并为一个账户或安排，常用于简化还款或降低风险（如债务、贷款或基金）。

examples.en: Her loans were reconsolidated into a single monthly payment.
examples.zh: 她的贷款被重新整合为一笔按月支付的款项。

examples.en: The fund was reconsolidated to reduce administrative costs.
examples.zh: 该基金被重新整合以降低管理成本。

definition.en: made stable again in the brain after being recalled, as a memory that can be updated (used in psychology/neuroscience).
definition.zh: （心理/神经科学）记忆被唤起后再次稳定下来，并可能在这一过程中被更新。

examples.en: In the study, the recalled memory was reconsolidated after a short delay.
examples.zh: 在这项研究中，被唤起的记忆在短暂延迟后再次巩固。

examples.en: Therapy can sometimes change how a memory is reconsolidated.
examples.zh: 治疗有时会改变记忆再次巩固的方式。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of reconsolidate; to reconsolidate means to unite and strengthen again.
definition.zh: reconsolidate 的过去式/过去分词；reconsolidate 指“再次合并并巩固”。

examples.en: They reconsolidated the project teams after the budget cuts.
examples.zh: 预算削减后，他们把项目团队重新整合并巩固。

extraExplanation: 词形提示：re-（再次）+ consolidate（巩固、合并）。因此 reconsolidated 常带有“经历过分散/动荡后再度整合并稳定”的含义。
学术语境中常见 reconsolidation（再巩固），尤其在神经科学里指记忆被提取后进入可塑状态，随后再次“固定”下来；这也是一些心理治疗研究会提到的机制。

summary.en: “Reconsolidates” means “consolidates again,” either by reorganizing/strengthening something or (in psychology) restabilizing a memory after recall.
summary.zh: “Reconsolidates”意为“再次巩固/再度整合”，可指重新合并加强事物，也可指（心理学）记忆回忆后的再巩固与重新存储。

definition.en: to combine or strengthen something again after it has been separated, weakened, or reorganized; to consolidate again
definition.zh: （在分散、削弱或重组之后）再次合并或巩固；再度整合

examples.en: After the merger, the company reconsolidates its regional teams into one national unit.
examples.zh: 并购之后，公司将各地区团队重新整合为一个全国部门。

examples.en: The coach reconsolidates the defense after several players are injured.
examples.zh: 几名球员受伤后，教练重新巩固防守阵容。

definition.en: (psychology/neuroscience) to store a memory again after it has been recalled, sometimes with changes
definition.zh: （心理学/神经科学）记忆被唤起后再次“再巩固”并重新存储，有时会发生改变

examples.en: When she talks about the event, her brain reconsolidates the memory and may alter small details.
examples.zh: 当她谈起那件事时，大脑会对记忆进行再巩固，可能会改动一些小细节。

examples.en: Therapy can help by guiding how the mind reconsolidates painful memories.
examples.zh: 治疗可以通过引导大脑如何再巩固痛苦记忆来提供帮助。

extraExplanation: “reconsolidates”是动词“reconsolidate”的第三人称单数现在时：he/she/it reconsolidates。常见时态：reconsolidate / reconsolidates / reconsolidated / reconsolidating。
心理学里的“memory reconsolidation（记忆再巩固）”指记忆被回忆时会变得短暂“可塑”，随后再次稳定存储；因此回忆并不是简单播放录像，细节可能在再巩固过程中被更新。

summary.en: “Reconsolidating” means consolidating again—either reorganizing something to make it stronger, or (in psychology) restabilizing a recalled memory.
summary.zh: “Reconsolidating”表示“再次巩固/重新整合”；也可指（心理学中）记忆被唤起后的“再巩固/再稳定”过程。

definition.en: consolidating again; bringing something back together into a stronger or more organized whole (often after change or disruption)
definition.zh: 再次巩固/重新整合；把事物在变化或受扰动后重新聚拢并变得更稳固、更有条理

examples.en: After the merger, the company is reconsolidating its departments to reduce overlap.
examples.zh: 合并之后，公司正在重新整合各部门，以减少重复设置。

examples.en: The team spent the afternoon reconsolidating their notes into a single report.
examples.zh: 团队花了一下午把笔记重新整理并合并成一份报告。

definition.en: (psychology/neuroscience) restabilizing a memory after it is recalled, sometimes allowing it to be updated
definition.zh: （心理学/神经科学）记忆在被提取（回想）后再次稳定的过程，有时会在此过程中被更新或改写

examples.en: In therapy, recalling an event can help with reconsolidating the memory in a less distressing way.
examples.zh: 在治疗中，回想某个事件有时能帮助以较不痛苦的方式重新巩固那段记忆。

examples.en: Researchers study how sleep affects reconsolidating emotional memories.
examples.zh: 研究人员在探讨睡眠如何影响情绪性记忆的再巩固。

extraExplanation: “Reconsolidating”是动词 reconsolidate 的现在分词/动名词形式，常用于进行时（is reconsolidating）或作名词性用法（reconsolidating memories）。
在记忆研究里，“再巩固（reconsolidation）”指记忆被唤起后会短暂变得不稳定，随后需要再次“加固”；在这个窗口期里，记忆可能被新信息影响，因此常被用于解释某些治疗方法为何能减轻创伤记忆的痛苦感。

summary.en: Reconsolidation means storing something again after it has been brought back, especially the re-storing (and possible updating) of a recalled memory.
summary.zh: reconsolidation 指“再巩固/再整合”，尤指被回想起的记忆在短暂可变后再次存储，并可能被更新。

definition.en: (Psychology/Neuroscience) The process in which a recalled memory becomes temporarily changeable and is then stored again, sometimes strengthened, weakened, or updated with new information.
definition.zh: （心理学/神经科学）记忆“再巩固”：当一个记忆被提取（想起）后，会短暂变得可被改变，随后再次被存储；在此过程中记忆可能被加强、削弱或被新信息更新。

examples.en: Therapists study memory reconsolidation to help people change painful emotional reactions.
examples.zh: 治疗师研究记忆再巩固，以帮助人们改变痛苦的情绪反应。

examples.en: After recalling the event, reconsolidation can update the memory with new details.
examples.zh: 在回想事件之后，再巩固可能会用新的细节更新这段记忆。

definition.en: A general act of consolidating something again; bringing separate parts back together into a unified form.
definition.zh: 广义：再次巩固；把分散的部分重新整合为一个统一整体的行为或过程。

examples.en: The team began the reconsolidation of their notes into one final report.
examples.zh: 团队开始把笔记重新整合成一份最终报告。

examples.en: The policy aims at the reconsolidation of services under one department.
examples.zh: 该政策旨在把服务重新归并到同一部门之下。

extraExplanation: “Reconsolidation”最常见于记忆研究领域。核心观点是：记忆不是每次回想都“原封不动”地读出，而是可能在回想后被改写再存回去。
在临床与教育语境中，这个概念常被用来解释：为什么新的解释、情绪体验或信息，可能改变旧记忆带来的感受与反应（例如减轻创伤反应、纠正错误信息）。
词形来源：re-（再次）+ consolidation（巩固/整合）。与“consolidation（初次巩固）”相对，前者强调“提取后再存储”的阶段。

summary.en: Reconsolidations are repeated processes of consolidating again—either reorganizing something to make it stable, or (in psychology) storing a recalled memory again, sometimes in an updated form.
summary.zh: Reconsolidations 指“再次巩固/重新整合”的过程；也可指（心理学中）记忆被提取后再次储存的“记忆再巩固”过程，可能带来更新。

definition.en: the act or process of consolidating again; making something (such as an organization, debt, or power) unified or stable again
definition.zh: 再次巩固；重新整合（如机构、债务、权力等），使其重新统一或稳定

examples.en: The company’s reconsolidations reduced costs by merging several small departments into one.
examples.zh: 这家公司通过重新整合，把几个小部门合并成一个，从而降低了成本。

examples.en: After the reforms, the government began reconsolidations of authority at the national level.
examples.zh: 改革之后，政府开始在国家层面重新巩固权力。

definition.en: (psychology/neuroscience) processes in which a recalled memory becomes changeable and is then stored again, sometimes in an updated form
definition.zh: （心理学/神经科学）再巩固：记忆被提取后会短暂变得可改变，随后再次被储存，有时会以更新后的形式保存

examples.en: Therapy may work partly by changing painful memories during reconsolidations.
examples.zh: 治疗之所以可能有效，部分原因在于它会在记忆再巩固过程中改变痛苦记忆。

examples.en: Sleep is often discussed as a time when reconsolidations can strengthen learning.
examples.zh: 人们常提到睡眠可能是记忆再巩固、强化学习的时期。

examples.en: New information can shape old beliefs during reconsolidations.
examples.zh: 在记忆再巩固过程中，新信息可能会影响旧有信念。

extraExplanation: “Reconsolidation”在心理学里很常见，尤其出现在“memory reconsolidation（记忆再巩固）”这个搭配中：当你把一段记忆想起来时，它会进入一个短暂的“可修改窗口”，之后再被存回去，所以回忆并不总是像播放录像那样“原封不动”。
词形上：re-（再一次）+ consolidation（巩固/整合）。你给出的“reconsolidations”是复数，常见于学术写作或报告中，用来表示多次/多种再巩固过程。

summary.en: Reconsoling means comforting someone (or yourself) again; it’s a less common form related to reconsole.
summary.zh: Reconsoling 指“再次安慰/重新慰藉”，是较少见的用法，来自动词 reconsole。

definition.en: comforting someone again; giving consolation again after new sadness or disappointment.
definition.zh: 再次安慰（某人）；在新的悲伤或失望之后重新给予慰藉。

examples.en: After the bad news, she spent the evening reconsoling her friend.
examples.zh: 听到坏消息后，她整个晚上都在再次安慰朋友。

examples.en: He wrote a second letter, reconsoling his family after another setback.
examples.zh: 又遇到挫折后，他写了第二封信，再次安慰家人。

definition.en: the present participle of reconsole: to comfort again; to console again.
definition.zh: reconsole 的现在分词：再次安慰；重新慰藉。

examples.en: I’m reconsoling myself by focusing on what I can control.
examples.zh: 我通过专注于自己能掌控的事情来再次安慰自己。

extraExplanation: “reconsoling”来自 re-（再次）+ console（安慰）。它在现代日常英语中比较少见；更常用的表达是 “comforting again / consoling again / trying to console (someone) again”。
在写作里用它可以强调“安慰发生了不止一次”，常见于较正式或文学化的语境。

summary.en: Reconstituent means “able to be re-formed from parts” or “a substance/component used to re-form something,” mainly in formal or scientific contexts.
summary.zh: Reconstituent 指“可由部分再次构成的”，或“用于重新构成/复原的成分（复原剂）”，多用于正式或科学语境。

definition.en: able to be made up again from parts; forming something again after it has been broken up or separated (often used in formal or scientific writing).
definition.zh: 可重新组成的；可由部分再次构成的（常见于正式或科学语境）。

examples.en: The powder is mixed with water to create a reconstituent solution.
examples.zh: 将粉末与水混合可制成可复原（重新配制）的溶液。

examples.en: They studied the reconstituent properties of the membrane after drying.
examples.zh: 他们研究了该膜在干燥后再次重组的性质。

definition.en: a component or substance used to form something again, especially by mixing or recombining.
definition.zh: （重新配制/重组时使用的）成分；复原剂（尤指通过混合或重组来形成某物）。

examples.en: Add the reconstituent gradually to avoid lumps.
examples.zh: 逐步加入复原成分，以避免结块。

examples.en: In the lab, the reconstituent was stored separately to keep it stable.
examples.zh: 在实验室里，复原剂被单独储存以保持稳定。

extraExplanation: “reconstituent”在日常英语里很少见，更常见的是“reconstituted（已复原/已重新配制的）”“reconstitute（使复原/使重新组成）”。如果你是在药学/化学/生物实验语境里看到它，通常与“将粉末加液体复溶、将分离的成分重新组合”等操作有关。
拼写上容易和“constituent（成分；选民）”混淆：constituent强调“组成部分/成分”，reconstituent强调“用于重新组成/复原的（成分）”或“可重新组成的”。

summary.en: Reconstitute means to make something return to its original form (often by adding water), or to reorganize and form something again.
summary.zh: reconstitute 指使某物恢复原状（常指加水复原），或重新组建/重组某个组织或群体。

definition.en: to make something return to its original form or state, often by adding water back to dried or concentrated material
definition.zh: 使（通常是干燥或浓缩的东西）恢复原状；（常指）加水复原

examples.en: Reconstitute the powdered milk with warm water.
examples.zh: 用温水把奶粉冲调复原。

examples.en: The lab reconstituted the sample before testing it.
examples.zh: 实验室在检测前先把样本复原。

examples.en: After the drought, the community tried to reconstitute its water supply system.
examples.zh: 干旱过后，社区努力恢复供水系统。

definition.en: to form something again or to reorganize it into a new working form (such as a group, committee, or organization)
definition.zh: 重组；重新组建（如委员会、机构等）

examples.en: The board voted to reconstitute the committee with new members.
examples.zh: 董事会投票决定用新成员重组委员会。

examples.en: The team was reconstituted after several players left.
examples.zh: 几名队员离开后，这支队伍被重新组建。

extraExplanation: 词根拆解：re- 表示“再次”，constitute 表示“组成、构成”。所以 reconstitute 的核心意思就是“再次构成/使恢复成原来的样子”。
常见搭配：reconstitute powdered milk/juice（冲调奶粉/浓缩果汁）；reconstitute a committee/government（重组委员会/政府）。
与类似词对比：restore 更偏“恢复到原状”（不一定强调重新组成）；rebuild 常指“重建”；reform 更偏“改革、改造”。

summary.en: Reconstituted usually means restored by adding liquid (like powder to milk), or reorganized/rebuilt (like a committee).
summary.zh: reconstituted通常指通过加液体把粉末/浓缩物“复原”，也可指机构、团体等“重组/重建”。

definition.en: made again by adding water or another liquid; restored from a dried, concentrated, or powdered form
definition.zh: （通过加水或其他液体）复原的；由干燥/浓缩/粉末状态重新调配成原状的

examples.en: Add hot water to the soup mix until it is fully reconstituted.
examples.zh: 往汤料里加热水，直到完全复原。

examples.en: The lab used reconstituted milk powder for the experiment.
examples.zh: 实验室用复原奶粉进行实验。

examples.en: After the long hike, they ate reconstituted noodles at camp.
examples.zh: 长途徒步后，他们在营地吃了复原面。

definition.en: brought back or restored to an earlier or proper form; rebuilt or reorganized
definition.zh: 恢复原状的；重建或重新组织的

examples.en: The committee was reconstituted after the elections.
examples.zh: 选举后，委员会被重新组建。

examples.en: The reconstituted archive includes documents once thought lost.
examples.zh: 这份重建的档案包含了曾被认为遗失的文件。

definition.en: past participle of “reconstitute” (to form again, rebuild, or restore)
definition.zh: “reconstitute”的过去分词（意为重新组成、重建、复原）

examples.en: They reconstituted the team with new members and clearer roles.
examples.zh: 他们用新成员和更清晰的分工重新组建了团队。

extraExplanation: “reconstituted”在食品包装中很常见，尤其指“用水把浓缩或粉末恢复成可食用/可饮用状态”，如reconstituted juice（复原果汁）、reconstituted milk（复原乳）。在正式语境里也可指机构或团体“改组/重建”。
词根提示：re-（再次）+ constitute（组成、构成）。因此它既可表示“再调配成原样”，也可表示“重新组成/恢复结构”。

summary.en: “Reconstitutes” means rebuilds or restores something, or mixes a dried/concentrated product with liquid to make it usable again.
summary.zh: “reconstitutes”表示重新组成/重建或使恢复原状；也可指把干燥或浓缩物加液体复原（如冲调奶粉、复溶药粉）。

definition.en: forms something again from its parts; rebuilds or recreates it
definition.zh: 把某物重新组成；重建或再造

examples.en: The committee reconstitutes the team every year with new members.
examples.zh: 委员会每年都会用新成员重新组建团队。

examples.en: The museum reconstitutes the ancient vase from broken pieces.
examples.zh: 博物馆把碎片重新拼合，复原那只古代花瓶。

definition.en: restores something to its former state, structure, or strength
definition.zh: 使恢复到原来的状态、结构或力量；复原

examples.en: After the merger, the company reconstitutes its leadership structure.
examples.zh: 合并之后，公司重组并恢复其领导架构。

examples.en: The policy reconstitutes the agency with a clearer mission.
examples.zh: 该政策以更明确的使命对机构进行重整。

definition.en: adds liquid to a dried or concentrated product so it returns to a usable form (rehydrates)
definition.zh: 加入液体使干燥或浓缩的东西恢复可用形态（复水、冲调）

examples.en: She reconstitutes powdered milk with warm water.
examples.zh: 她用温水把奶粉冲调成牛奶。

examples.en: The nurse reconstitutes the medicine before giving the injection.
examples.zh: 护士在注射前先把药物复溶/配制好。

extraExplanation: “reconstitutes”是动词“reconstitute”的第三人称单数现在时（he/she/it reconstitutes）。常见于正式写作与专业语境（组织重组、法律/政府机构恢复、实验室复溶试剂、食品复水等）。
在药学/实验室里，reconstitute 常指把冻干粉或浓缩物加入溶剂使其“复溶/配制”；在食品里常译为“冲调、复水”。

summary.en: Reconstituting means forming something again or restoring it—often by reorganizing a group/system or by mixing a dried/concentrated substance back into liquid.
summary.zh: reconstituting 指“重新组成/恢复”，常用于重组机构或把干燥/浓缩物与液体混合使其复原（复水/复溶）。

definition.en: (present participle of reconstitute) forming or putting something together again after it has been broken, removed, or ended; restoring it to a previous state.
definition.zh: （reconstitute 的现在分词）把某物在被破坏、拆散或中断后重新组成；使恢复到原来的状态。

examples.en: The committee is reconstituting the team after several members resigned.
examples.zh: 在几位成员辞职后，委员会正在重新组建这个团队。

examples.en: After the war, the city focused on reconstituting its public services.
examples.zh: 战后，这座城市把重点放在恢复公共服务上。

definition.en: mixing a concentrated or dried substance with water (or another liquid) to return it to its original form; rehydrating.
definition.zh: 把浓缩物或干燥物与水（或其他液体）混合，使其恢复到原来的形态；复水。

examples.en: She is reconstituting powdered milk for the recipe.
examples.zh: 她正在把奶粉冲调成配方所需的牛奶。

examples.en: In the lab, the researcher is reconstituting the dried sample in a buffer solution.
examples.zh: 在实验室里，研究人员正在用缓冲液复溶干燥样品。

definition.en: reorganizing or establishing an organization or system again, often with new rules or members.
definition.zh: 重新组织或重新设立某个机构/体系，常伴随新规则或新成员。

examples.en: The board is reconstituting the department to improve efficiency.
examples.zh: 董事会正在重组该部门以提高效率。

extraExplanation:
“reconstituting”常见于三类语境：
1）组织/团队：reconstitute a committee/board/team（重组委员会/董事会/团队）；
2）食品：reconstitute powdered milk/juice（冲调奶粉/浓缩果汁）；
3）医学/科研：reconstitute a vaccine/drug/sample（复溶疫苗/药物/样品）。

词源上，re- 表示“再次”，constitute 表示“构成、组成”。因此它比单纯的 “make again” 更强调“按结构重新组成/恢复”。

summary.en: Reconstitution means forming something again—either rebuilding/restoring an organization or system, or rehydrating a dried/concentrated product by adding liquid.
summary.zh: Reconstitution 指“重新组成/重建/恢复”，也可指把干燥或浓缩的产品加液“复原/复水”。

definition.en: the act or process of forming something again, rebuilding it, or restoring it after change or damage
definition.zh: （事物的）重新组成；重建；恢复（在改变或受损之后再次形成或复原）

examples.en: After the war, the country focused on the reconstitution of its cities and economy.
examples.zh: 战争结束后，这个国家把重心放在城市和经济的重建上。

examples.en: The committee met to discuss the reconstitution of the organization.
examples.zh: 委员会开会讨论该组织的重新组建。

definition.en: the process of adding water or another liquid to make a dried or concentrated product usable again
definition.zh: （食品/药品等）复原；复水（加入水或其他液体，使干燥或浓缩的产品恢复可用）

examples.en: Follow the directions for the reconstitution of the powdered medicine.
examples.zh: 请按说明书操作，给药粉加液进行复原。

examples.en: Instant soup needs reconstitution with hot water.
examples.zh: 速食汤需要用热水复原。

extraExplanation: 词源上来自“re-（再次）+ constitution（构成、组织）”，因此既可用于抽象意义的“重建/恢复”，也常见于医药和食品说明中表示“复原/复水”。
在正式写作里，reconstitution 比 rebuild/restore 更“制度化/程序化”，常用于政府、组织架构、委员会、议会等的“重新组建”。

summary.en: Reconstruct means to build again, or to piece together and recreate something—especially a structure, an object, or past events—from parts or evidence.
summary.zh: Reconstruct 指“重建”，也可指“把碎片或证据拼合起来以还原/重现”某物或某个事件。

definition.en: To build something again after it has been damaged or destroyed; to restore it.
definition.zh: （在受损或被毁后）重建；修复；恢复。

examples.en: The city worked for years to reconstruct the bridge after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，这座城市花了多年时间重建那座桥。

examples.en: After the fire, they reconstructed the house using safer materials.
examples.zh: 火灾后，他们用更安全的材料重建了房子。

definition.en: To form an idea of a past event by putting together details and evidence; to recreate in the mind.
definition.zh: （根据细节与证据）还原；重现（过去的事件）；推断出事情经过。

examples.en: Police tried to reconstruct what happened from witness reports.
examples.zh: 警方试图根据目击者的报告还原事情经过。

examples.en: It can be hard to reconstruct childhood memories accurately.
examples.zh: 要准确还原童年记忆可能很难。

definition.en: To assemble something again, often from separate parts or pieces.
definition.zh: （把分散的部分）重新组装；重新拼装。

examples.en: He reconstructed the model airplane after it broke into pieces.
examples.zh: 模型飞机碎了之后，他把它重新组装起来。

examples.en: Scientists reconstructed the skeleton from scattered bones.
examples.zh: 科学家用散落的骨头重建（拼出）骨架。

extraExplanation: 词源上，re- 表示“再次”，construct 表示“建造”，合起来就是“再次建造/重建”。
在学术与新闻语境中，reconstruct 常用于“重建历史/还原现场”，强调“基于证据拼合出整体”。
常见搭配：reconstruct a building/city（重建建筑/城市），reconstruct the events（还原事件经过），reconstruct from evidence（依据证据还原）。

summary.en: Reconstructed means “built again” or “recreated from evidence,” and it is also the past form of reconstruct.
summary.zh: reconstructed 表示“重建的/复原的”，也可作动词 reconstruct 的过去式/过去分词。

definition.en: built or formed again after being damaged, destroyed, or changed; restored to a usable condition.
definition.zh: （在受损、被毁或改变后）重建的；重新修复并恢复可用的。

examples.en: The reconstructed bridge reopened to traffic last month.
examples.zh: 那座重建的桥上个月重新开放通车。

examples.en: They walked through a reconstructed old town to learn local history.
examples.zh: 他们走在复原重建的老街区里了解当地历史。

definition.en: made again by putting parts, evidence, or memories together; recreated (often in science, history, or art).
definition.zh: （根据碎片、证据或记忆）重现的；复原的（常用于科学、历史或艺术）。

examples.en: Police shared a reconstructed timeline of events.
examples.zh: 警方公布了重建（复原）的事件时间线。

examples.en: The museum displayed a reconstructed dinosaur skeleton.
examples.zh: 博物馆展出了复原的恐龙骨架。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of reconstruct: to build again or to form again from pieces or information.
definition.zh: reconstruct 的过去式/过去分词：重建；（从碎片或信息中）复原、重构。

examples.en: Engineers reconstructed the road after the flood.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，工程师重建了那条道路。

examples.en: Researchers reconstructed the painting from old photos.
examples.zh: 研究人员根据老照片复原了那幅画。

extraExplanation: “reconstructed”既可指实体的“重建”（如桥、房屋），也常指信息或历史的“重构/复原”（如时间线、恐龙骨架）。语境不同，侧重点会从“修复建筑”转向“依据证据再现”。
在美国历史语境中，Reconstruction（首字母大写）常指南北战争后“重建时期”（1865–1877），但这属于专有名词；一般说“reconstructed”多是普通形容词/动词用法。

summary.en: Reconstructible means “able to be rebuilt or restored (physically or from evidence).”
summary.zh: reconstructible 指「能被重建或復原的」（可指實物重建，也可指從證據重建）。

definition.en: Able to be built again, put back together, or restored from parts or evidence.
definition.zh: 可重建的；可重新組裝的；可從證據中復原的。

examples.en: The damaged bridge is reconstructible with modern materials.
examples.zh: 這座受損的橋可以用現代材料重建。

examples.en: The archaeologists believe the pot is reconstructible from the broken pieces.
examples.zh: 考古學家認為這個陶罐可以用碎片復原。

examples.en: The timeline is reconstructible from emails and phone records.
examples.zh: 時間線可以根據電子郵件和通話紀錄重建出來。

extraExplanation: 「reconstructible」由 re-（再次）+ construct（建造）+ -ible（能夠……的）組成，意思是「能再次被建造／復原的」。
在學術與專業語境中很常見，例如考古（從碎片復原文物）、法醫與歷史研究（從證據重建事件）、工程（災後重建）。

summary.en: Reconstructing means rebuilding something or re-creating/figuring out the past from evidence.
summary.zh: Reconstructing 指重建某物，或依据证据复原/还原过去发生的事。

definition.en: building something again after it has been damaged or destroyed; rebuilding
definition.zh: （把受损或被毁的东西）重建；重新建造

examples.en: The city is reconstructing the bridge after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，这座城市正在重建那座桥。

examples.en: They are reconstructing the old theater to make it safe for visitors.
examples.zh: 他们正在重建这座老剧院，让游客能安全参观。

definition.en: trying to form a clear picture of a past event by using evidence and details; piecing together what happened
definition.zh: （根据证据与细节）还原过去发生的事；重现经过

examples.en: Police are reconstructing the accident using videos and witness statements.
examples.zh: 警方正在根据视频和目击者陈述还原事故经过。

examples.en: She spent months reconstructing her family history from letters and photos.
examples.zh: 她花了几个月用信件和照片还原家族历史。

definition.en: recreating something (such as a text, image, or model) from incomplete or damaged information
definition.zh: （根据残缺信息）复原、重构（如文本、图像或模型）

examples.en: The researchers are reconstructing the missing parts of the manuscript.
examples.zh: 研究人员正在复原手稿缺失的部分。

examples.en: Doctors can help by reconstructing facial features after an injury.
examples.zh: 受伤后，医生可以通过面部重建来提供帮助。

extraExplanation: “reconstructing”是动词reconstruct的现在分词/动名词形式，常用于进行时（are reconstructing）或作名词用法（Reconstructing the scene took hours）。
在美国历史语境中，Reconstruction（“重建时期”）特指南北战争后（1865–1877）美国南方的政治与社会重建；这个是专有名词，用大写，含义比一般的“重建”更具体。

summary.en: Reconstruction means rebuilding or restoring something; it can also mean recreating the past from evidence, or (capitalized) the U.S. post–Civil War era (1865–1877).
summary.zh: reconstruction 指“重建/修复”，也可指“依据证据复原过去”；首字母大写时常特指美国内战后的“重建时期”（1865–1877）。

definition.en: the act or process of building something again, repairing it, or putting it back together after damage
definition.zh: 重建；修复；复原（把受损的事物重新建起来或修好）

examples.en: After the earthquake, the city began reconstruction of roads and schools.
examples.zh: 地震后，这座城市开始重建道路和学校。

examples.en: The museum is closed for reconstruction of its main hall.
examples.zh: 博物馆因主大厅修缮重建而关闭。

definition.en: (U.S. history) the period after the American Civil War (1865–1877) when the U.S. tried to rebuild the South and redefine political and civil rights, especially for formerly enslaved people
definition.zh: （美国历史）重建时期：美国内战后（1865–1877）重建南方并重新界定政治与公民权利（尤其涉及被解放的黑人）的时期

examples.en: Reconstruction changed the Constitution through new amendments.
examples.zh: 重建时期通过新增修正案改变了美国宪法。

examples.en: Many debates about voting rights trace back to Reconstruction.
examples.zh: 许多关于投票权的争论可以追溯到重建时期。

definition.en: the act of forming an idea about what something in the past was like, using evidence (for example, from documents or archaeology)
definition.zh: （依据证据的）重现；复原推测：根据文件、考古等证据推断过去的样貌

examples.en: The historian offered a reconstruction of daily life in the 1800s.
examples.zh: 这位历史学家对19世纪的日常生活做了复原性描绘。

examples.en: Scientists made a reconstruction of the dinosaur’s skull from fossil fragments.
examples.zh: 科学家根据化石碎片复原了恐龙的头骨。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：reconstruction = re-（再次）+ construction（建造）。所以它既可指“再次建造/修复”，也可引申为“把信息重新拼起来”的“复原/重现”。
文化与文学背景：在美国语境中，Reconstruction（首字母大写）常特指内战后的“重建时期”。相关主题常出现在历史著作、教材与影视作品中，讨论的焦点包括南方重建、种族关系、投票权与宪法修正案（如第13、14、15条）。
搭配建议：常见说法有 postwar reconstruction（战后重建）、reconstruction efforts（重建工作/努力）、under reconstruction（正在重建/修缮中）。

summary.en: Reconstructional means “related to reconstruction,” either rebuilding something physically or reconstructing the past using evidence (academic use).
summary.zh: reconstructional 意为“与重建/重构有关的”，可指现实中的重建工程，也可指学术上依据证据对过去进行重构。

definition.en: Related to reconstructing something—building it again after damage, loss, or change.
definition.zh: 与“重建/再建”有关的；指在损坏、消失或变化后重新建造或恢复的。

examples.en: The city approved a reconstructional plan to rebuild the bridge after the flood.
examples.zh: 市政府批准了一项重建计划，在洪水后重建那座桥。

examples.en: Reconstructional work on the old theater took two years.
examples.zh: 那座老剧院的重建工程持续了两年。

definition.en: In academic writing (especially history or linguistics), involving reconstruction—trying to recover how something likely was in the past using evidence.
definition.zh: （学术语境，尤指历史或语言学）与“重构”有关的；指依据证据推测并还原过去可能的样貌。

examples.en: The paper uses reconstructional methods to infer the original wording of the text.
examples.zh: 这篇论文使用重构方法来推断文本的原始措辞。

examples.en: In historical linguistics, reconstructional analysis compares related languages to guess earlier forms.
examples.zh: 在历史语言学中，重构分析会比较亲属语言，以推测更早期的形式。

extraExplanation: “reconstructional”相对少见，更常用的是 “reconstructive”（偏“有助于修复/重建的”）或直接用 “reconstruction”（名词）作定语（如 reconstruction plan）。学术写作里偶尔会用 “reconstructional” 来强调“与重构方法/过程相关”。
容易联想到美国历史上的 “Reconstruction”（南北战争后的“重建时期”）；但日常英语中说“重建时期的政策/政府”等，通常写作 “Reconstruction-era” 或 “Reconstruction” 作定语，而不是 reconstructional。

summary.en: An uncommon adjective meaning “related to Reconstruction,” especially the U.S. Reconstruction era; sometimes used more generally for “related to rebuilding.”
summary.zh: 一个较少见的形容词，意为“与重建有关”，尤指美国南北战争后的“重建时期”；有时也泛指“与重建/再造有关”。

definition.en: Relating to Reconstruction—especially the period after the U.S. Civil War when the Southern states were reorganized and formerly enslaved people’s rights were debated and protected (1865–1877).
definition.zh: 与“重建时期”有关的，尤指美国南北战争后对南方各州进行重组、并围绕（并一度保障）解放奴隶权利的“重建时代”（1865–1877）。

examples.en: The article examines reconstructionary politics in the South after the Civil War.
examples.zh: 这篇文章研究了南北战争后南方的重建时期政治。

examples.en: Reconstructionary amendments changed the U.S. Constitution by addressing citizenship and voting rights.
examples.zh: 重建时期的修正案通过涉及公民身份与投票权，改变了美国宪法。

definition.en: Relating to rebuilding or reconstructing something (less common and often replaced by “reconstructive” or “reconstruction”).
definition.zh: 与重建、再造有关的（较少见，常被“reconstructive”或“reconstruction”取代）。

examples.en: They proposed a reconstructionary plan for the damaged bridge.
examples.zh: 他们提出了一个用于重建受损桥梁的方案。

extraExplanation:
“reconstructionary”在现代英语中比较少见，更常见的表达是：
- 讲历史时期：Reconstruction-era / post-Reconstruction
- 讲“重建”的性质：reconstructive
如果你是在写美国史论文，用“Reconstruction-era”通常更自然、更常用。

summary.en: Reconstructionism most commonly means a focus on rebuilding and reforming society after disruption; it can also refer to a social-reform approach in education or to Reconstructionist Judaism.
summary.zh: reconstructionism 常指动荡后以重建与改革为核心的社会/政治思路；也可指教育中的“社会重建主义”，或宗教上的“犹太教重建派”。

definition.en: A political view or movement that focuses on rebuilding and reforming a society after major disruption (such as war or a civil conflict), often by changing laws and institutions.
definition.zh: （政治）重建主义：强调在重大动荡（如战争、内战）后重建社会并推动改革的观点或运动，常涉及法律与制度的重塑。

examples.en: After the civil war, reconstructionism shaped debates about citizenship and voting rights.
examples.zh: 内战结束后，重建主义影响了关于公民身份与投票权的辩论。

examples.en: Some leaders argued for reconstructionism to modernize the country’s institutions.
examples.zh: 一些领导人主张通过重建主义来使国家制度现代化。

definition.en: An educational philosophy that says schools should actively work to improve society, for example by teaching students to solve real social problems.
definition.zh: （教育）社会重建主义：一种教育理念，主张学校应积极推动社会进步，例如培养学生解决真实社会问题的能力。

examples.en: In reconstructionism, students discuss social issues and propose practical solutions.
examples.zh: 在社会重建主义中，学生会讨论社会议题并提出可行的解决方案。

examples.en: Her teaching style reflects reconstructionism: learning is linked to social responsibility.
examples.zh: 她的教学风格体现了社会重建主义：把学习与社会责任联系起来。

definition.en: A modern Jewish religious movement (Reconstructionist Judaism) that emphasizes Judaism as an evolving culture and community tradition.
definition.zh: （宗教）犹太教重建主义（重建派）：强调犹太教是一种不断演变的文化与共同体传统的现代宗教运动。

examples.en: He attends a Reconstructionist congregation that welcomes diverse beliefs.
examples.zh: 他参加一个重建派会堂，包容多元信念。

examples.en: Reconstructionism often highlights community practice alongside personal faith.
examples.zh: 重建主义常强调共同体实践与个人信仰并重。

extraExplanation: 这个词在英语里不止一个领域使用。最常见的背景之一是美国历史中的“Reconstruction（重建时期）”，指美国内战后对南方各州的重建与改革；不过“reconstructionism”并不只限定美国，也可泛指战后或危机后以制度改革为核心的“重建思路”。
教育学里的 reconstructionism 常与“progressive education（进步主义教育）”一起讨论：它更强调学校应参与社会改造、鼓励学生关注公平、民主与公共议题。
宗教语境中它通常指 Reconstructionist Judaism（犹太教重建派）。在写作中建议明确标注领域，以免读者误解。

summary.en: A reconstructionist is someone who supports rebuilding or reforming a society or system, especially in the context of U.S. Reconstruction after the Civil War.
summary.zh: reconstructionist 指支持重建或改革社会/制度的人（或“重建主义的”），尤常用于美国内战后的“重建时期”语境。

definition.en: a person who supports rebuilding or reforming a society, government, or system after major damage or change; especially someone connected with the Reconstruction era in the U.S. after the Civil War
definition.zh: 主张在重大破坏或变革后重建、改革社会/政府/制度的人；尤指与美国内战后“重建时期（Reconstruction）”相关的人

examples.en: After the war, Reconstructionists argued that the South needed new laws to protect formerly enslaved people.
examples.zh: 战争结束后，重建派主张南方需要新法律来保护曾被奴役的人。

examples.en: Some newspapers attacked Reconstructionists for pushing rapid political change.
examples.zh: 一些报纸抨击重建派推动快速的政治变革。

definition.en: relating to or supporting reconstruction, especially the rebuilding of institutions, policies, or society after conflict
definition.zh: 与重建有关的；支持重建的（尤指冲突后对制度、政策或社会的重建）

examples.en: The group promoted a reconstructionist plan for reforming local government.
examples.zh: 该组织推动一项重建主义的方案来改革地方政府。

examples.en: They took a reconstructionist approach, focusing on rebuilding schools and courts first.
examples.zh: 他们采取重建主义的方式，优先重建学校和法院。

extraExplanation: “Reconstructionist”最常见的历史语境是美国内战后（约1865–1877）的“重建时期”。当时围绕如何让南方各州重新加入联邦、如何保障解放黑人的公民权利等问题，出现了不同立场的政治力量；在一些史学与政治讨论中，“Reconstructionists”常指支持更积极、更深度改革的一方。
词形上：re-（再次）+ construct（建造）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ reconstruction（重建）+ -ist（“……主义者/支持者”）。因此它既可指“人”（名词），也可作形容词表示“重建派/重建主义的”。

summary.en: Reconstructions are rebuildings after damage, or evidence-based re-creations/models of something from the past.
summary.zh: Reconstructions 指灾后重建/复建，也可指基于证据的复原或重现模型。

definition.en: the act or process of rebuilding something after it has been damaged or destroyed; rebuildings
definition.zh: （被破坏后）重建；复建（的过程或行为）

examples.en: After the earthquake, the city began several major reconstructions of bridges and roads.
examples.zh: 地震之后，这座城市开始了多项桥梁和道路的重大重建工程。

examples.en: The museum stayed closed during the reconstructions of its main hall.
examples.zh: 博物馆在主展厅重建期间一直关闭。

definition.en: new versions or models of something from the past, created using evidence (e.g., historical, scientific, or forensic); re-creations
definition.zh: （基于证据的）复原版本；重现模型（如历史、科学或法医领域）

examples.en: Archaeologists compared different reconstructions of the ancient temple.
examples.zh: 考古学家比较了这座古代神庙的不同复原方案。

examples.en: The documentary used digital reconstructions to show what the ship might have looked like.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片用数字复原来展示那艘船可能的样子。

extraExplanation: “reconstruction(s)”在美国历史语境中也可特指“重建时期（Reconstruction）”，指南北战争结束后（约1865–1877）美国南方各州在政治、经济与社会制度上的重建与改革。若你在历史文章里看到大写的 Reconstruction，往往就是这个专有含义。

summary.en: Reconstructive means “related to rebuilding or restoring,” especially in medical contexts like reconstructive surgery.
summary.zh: reconstructive 表示“与重建、修复、恢复有关”，尤常用于医学语境，如重建手术。

definition.en: Relating to rebuilding, repairing, or restoring something to a better or more normal condition (often used in medicine, surgery, or therapy).
definition.zh: 与重建、修复或恢复有关的（常用于医学、外科或康复治疗领域）。

examples.en: She needed reconstructive surgery after the accident.
examples.zh: 事故后她需要做重建手术。

examples.en: The clinic offers reconstructive treatment for burn patients.
examples.zh: 这家诊所为烧伤患者提供重建治疗。

definition.en: Involving putting something back together again—recreating its original shape, form, or details based on evidence or memory.
definition.zh: 涉及把某物重新拼回去——根据证据或记忆重现其原有形状、形式或细节。

examples.en: They used reconstructive methods to piece together the broken statue.
examples.zh: 他们用重建方法把破碎的雕像拼起来。

examples.en: The documentary included a reconstructive timeline of the events.
examples.zh: 这部纪录片包含对事件的重建时间线。

extraExplanation: 在英语里更常见的搭配是“reconstructive surgery（重建手术）”，尤其指事故、肿瘤切除或烧伤后的修复与重建；它不同于“cosmetic surgery（整形/美容手术）”，后者更偏向改善外观而非功能性恢复。
词源上来自 reconstruct（重建）+ -ive（形容词后缀，表示“具有……性质/倾向”），所以整体意思就是“用于/关于重建的”。

summary.en: Reconstructively means “in a way that rebuilds or reconstructs,” either physically (repairing) or intellectually (recreating from evidence).
summary.zh: reconstructively 意为“以重建/重构的方式”，既可指实体修复，也可指根据证据对过去或情境进行重现与推断。

definition.en: In a way that rebuilds or restores something; by reconstructing it (physically or in form).
definition.zh: 以重建或修复的方式；通过重构（在实体或结构上）来恢复。

examples.en: After the accident, the surgeon worked reconstructively to repair the patient’s face.
examples.zh: 事故后，外科医生以重建性方式修复了病人的面部。

examples.en: The city is planning reconstructively, rebuilding roads and bridges step by step.
examples.zh: 这座城市正在以重建的方式规划，逐步重修道路和桥梁。

definition.en: In a way that recreates or pieces together the past or a situation from evidence (a reconstructive approach).
definition.zh: 以重现、拼接过去或情境的方式；通过证据进行重构式推断。

examples.en: The historian argued reconstructively, using letters and diaries to rebuild the story.
examples.zh: 这位历史学者以重构式论证，利用书信和日记还原故事。

examples.en: In therapy, she spoke reconstructively about her childhood, trying to make sense of scattered memories.
examples.zh: 在治疗中，她以重构的方式谈起童年，试图理解零散的记忆。

extraExplanation: “reconstructively”来自 reconstruct（重建、重构）+ -ive（……的）+ -ly（以……方式）。它语体较正式，常见于医学（如 reconstructive surgery）、学术研究（历史/语言学的重建）或心理治疗语境中。日常口语里更常说 “in a reconstructive way / by rebuilding”。

summary.en: Reconstructiveness means the quality or tendency of rebuilding or re-forming something, physically or mentally.
summary.zh: Reconstructiveness 指“重建/重构的特质或倾向”，可用于实体重建或心理、信息等的重新建构。

definition.en: the quality or tendency of rebuilding, restoring, or forming something again (often after damage or change)
definition.zh: 重建性；重构性（指在受损或改变后重新建造、恢复或再形成的倾向/特质）

examples.en: The reconstructiveness of the program helped the community recover after the hurricane.
examples.zh: 这个项目的重建性帮助社区在飓风后恢复过来。

examples.en: She studied the reconstructiveness of memory—how people rebuild past events in their minds.
examples.zh: 她研究记忆的重构性——人们如何在头脑中重新建构过去的事件。

extraExplanation: “reconstructiveness”并不是特别常用的词，更常见的表达是 **reconstructive (adj.)**（重建的/重构的）或 **reconstruction (n.)**（重建/重构）。例如：reconstructive surgery（重建手术）、postwar reconstruction（战后重建）。
构词理解：**re-**（再次）+ **construct**（建造/构成）+ **-ive**（…的）+ **-ness**（…性/性质），所以它强调“具有重建/重构特征的性质”。

summary.en: A reconstructor is someone who rebuilds or restores something, or a specialist who recreates something from evidence.
summary.zh: reconstructor 指重建或修复的人，也可指根据证据进行复原/重构的专家。

definition.en: a person who rebuilds or restores something after it has been damaged or destroyed
definition.zh: 重建者；重构者（在破坏或损坏后进行修复或重建的人）

examples.en: After the earthquake, the reconstructor worked with engineers to rebuild the bridge.
examples.zh: 地震之后，重建者与工程师一起重建那座桥。

examples.en: The museum hired a reconstructor to restore the collapsed exhibit.
examples.zh: 博物馆雇了一位重建人员来修复倒塌的展品。

definition.en: a specialist who restores or reconstructs something in a particular field (such as surgery, archaeology, or history)
definition.zh: （特定领域的）重建/重构专家（如整形修复外科、考古或历史复原）

examples.en: The reconstructor used old photographs to recreate the original room layout.
examples.zh: 这位复原专家用旧照片重现了房间原本的布局。

examples.en: In reconstructive surgery, a reconstructor may help repair injuries after an accident.
examples.zh: 在修复重建外科中，重建医生可能帮助修复事故后的伤损。

extraExplanation: “reconstructor”由 re-（再次）+ construct（建造/构建）+ -or（做某事的人）组成，字面意思就是“再次建造的人”。
日常英语里更常见的说法通常是 “reconstructor” 的同义表达，例如：rebuilder（重建者）、restorer（修复者）、reconstruction specialist（重建/复原专家）。在医学语境中，常见搭配是 reconstructive surgeon（修复重建外科医生）。

summary.en: “Reconstructs” means builds something again or recreates past events/structures based on evidence (3rd-person singular present of “reconstruct”).
summary.zh: “reconstructs” 表示重建、复原，或根据证据还原过去（是 “reconstruct” 的一般现在时第三人称单数形式）。

definition.en: to build something again after it has been damaged or destroyed; to restore it
definition.zh: （在损坏或被毁后）重建；修复；复原

examples.en: After the earthquake, the city reconstructs damaged bridges and roads.
examples.zh: 地震后，这座城市重建受损的桥梁和道路。

examples.en: The museum reconstructs the old house using original photos.
examples.zh: 博物馆根据原始照片复原那座老房子。

definition.en: to form an idea of what happened or what something was like in the past by using evidence
definition.zh: （根据证据）重现；还原（过去发生的事或原貌）

examples.en: The police reconstructs the accident from witness reports.
examples.zh: 警方根据目击者的陈述还原事故经过。

examples.en: Historians reconstruct daily life in ancient cities from artifacts.
examples.zh: 历史学家通过文物重现古城的日常生活。

definition.en: to put something together again by arranging parts in a new or organized way
definition.zh: 重新组装；重新整理（把部分重新组合得更有条理）

examples.en: The technician reconstructs the device after replacing the broken part.
examples.zh: 技术人员更换损坏零件后重新组装设备。

extraExplanation: “reconstructs” 是动词 “reconstruct” 的一般现在时第三人称单数形式（he/she/it reconstructs）。常用于描述习惯性动作、规律性工作流程，或新闻报道中对机构行动的陈述（如：The city reconstructs…）。

summary.en: Reconstrue means to interpret something again, often in a new way; rarely, it can mean to rebuild, but “reconstruct” is more common.
summary.zh: Reconstrue 指“重新解释/重新诠释”（最常用）；较少见的意思是“重建”，但现代通常用 reconstruct。

definition.en: to interpret something again, often in a new way; to give a different meaning to something
definition.zh: 重新解释（某事），常带有以新的方式理解或赋予不同含义之意

examples.en: After hearing the full story, she reconstrued his comment as a joke, not an insult.
examples.zh: 听完整个故事后，她把他的话重新理解为一个玩笑，而不是侮辱。

examples.en: The lawyer tried to reconstrue the contract terms to favor her client.
examples.zh: 律师试图重新解释合同条款，使其对自己的当事人更有利。

definition.en: to build again; to reconstruct (rare in modern use—usually replaced by “reconstruct”)
definition.zh: 重建；再建（现代较少用，通常用 reconstruct）

examples.en: The city planned to reconstrue the bridge after the flood.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，这座城市计划重建那座桥。

extraExplanation: 词源上，reconstrue = re-（再次）+ construe（解释、阐释）。现代英语里它最常见的意思是“重新解读/重新诠释”，在学术写作、评论、法律语境中更常见。
注意与 reconstruct 区分：reconstruct 更偏“重建/复原（事物本身）”，reconstrue 更偏“重新解释（意义/说法）”。第二个“重建”的含义在当代用法中较少见。

summary.en: Reconsult means to consult again for confirmation or more details.
summary.zh: reconsult 指为确认或获取更多细节而“再次咨询/再次查阅”。

definition.en: to consult (someone or something) again in order to check, confirm, or get more information
definition.zh: 再次咨询（某人）或再次查阅（某物），以核实、确认或获取更多信息

examples.en: Before we make a final decision, let’s reconsult the doctor.
examples.zh: 在做最终决定之前，我们再咨询一下医生。

examples.en: She reconsulted the report to make sure the numbers were correct.
examples.zh: 她又查阅了一遍报告，确保数字无误。

extraExplanation: “reconsult”较为正式、书面，日常口语里更常说“consult again”“check again”或“go back and check”。
常见搭配：reconsult the doctor/lawyer; reconsult the notes/report; reconsult with the team（也可写作“consult again with…”）。

summary.en: A reconsultation is a follow-up consultation—another meeting with a professional to review or update a plan.
summary.zh: reconsultation 指“复诊/后续咨询”，即再次与专业人士会面以复查或调整方案。

definition.en: A second or follow-up meeting with a professional (especially a doctor or lawyer) to review results, discuss progress, or adjust a plan.
definition.zh: （尤指医疗或法律等领域的）复诊；再次/后续咨询，用于查看结果、评估进展或调整方案。

examples.en: The doctor scheduled a reconsultation in two weeks to review my test results.
examples.zh: 医生安排我两周后复诊，以查看化验结果。

examples.en: After the first meeting, we booked a reconsultation to go over the contract details.
examples.zh: 第一次会面后，我们又预约了一次后续咨询来仔细讨论合同细节。

extraExplanation: “reconsultation”在日常英语中不如“follow-up appointment / follow-up consultation / review appointment”常见，但在正式写作或医疗系统语境中可以看到。
拼写上有时会写作“re-consultation”（加连字符），含义相同。
搭配常见：schedule/book a reconsultation（预约复诊/再次咨询）、return for a reconsultation（回来复诊）、reconsultation fee（复诊费用）。

summary.en: Recontact means to contact someone again.
summary.zh: recontact 指“再次联系某人”。

definition.en: to contact someone again (by phone, email, message, etc.)
definition.zh: 再次联系某人（通过电话、邮件、信息等）

examples.en: I’ll recontact you next week after I check the schedule.
examples.zh: 我查看完日程后，下周再联系你。

examples.en: Please recontact the customer to confirm the address.
examples.zh: 请再次联系客户确认地址。

extraExplanation: “re-” 是常见前缀，表示“再次/重新”。因此 recontact 就是“再联系”。在正式商务写作里很常见。
更口语的说法常用 contact you again / get back to you。get back to you 更强调“稍后回复你/回信”，不一定是“再次联系”。

summary.en: Recontaminate means to contaminate something again after it was cleaned or made safe.
summary.zh: recontaminate 指某物在被清洁或处理安全后，再次受到污染。

definition.en: to contaminate something again after it has been cleaned or made safe
definition.zh: 在已经清洁或处理安全之后，再次使某物受到污染

examples.en: After the spill was cleaned up, heavy rain recontaminated the river.
examples.zh: 泄漏清理后，暴雨又让河流再次受到污染。

examples.en: If you touch the sterile surface with bare hands, you may recontaminate it.
examples.zh: 如果你用手直接触碰无菌表面，可能会把它再次污染。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”。因此 recontaminate = contaminate（污染）+ re-（再一次）。
这个词多见于科学、医疗、食品安全、环境治理等语境；日常口语更常说 “contaminate again / get contaminated again”。
常见搭配：recontaminate a surface/area/water supply（再次污染表面/区域/供水系统）；recontamination（名词：再污染）。

summary.en: “Recontaminated” means contaminated again after being cleaned or made safe.
summary.zh: “recontaminated”表示在清洁或确保安全后又再次被污染。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “recontaminate”: to contaminate something again after it was cleaned or made safe.
definition.zh: “recontaminate”的过去式/过去分词：在已经清洁或确保安全之后，再次使某物受到污染。

examples.en: The lab samples were recontaminated when the container wasn’t sealed properly.
examples.zh: 由于容器没有正确密封，实验室样本被再次污染了。

examples.en: After the flood, the drinking water system was cleaned but later recontaminated.
examples.zh: 洪水过后饮用水系统被清理过，但后来又再次被污染。

definition.en: Describing something that has become contaminated again.
definition.zh: （形容）指某物再次变得受污染的。

examples.en: They disposed of the recontaminated food to prevent illness.
examples.zh: 他们处理掉再次被污染的食物，以防生病。

examples.en: The recontaminated equipment had to be sterilized again.
examples.zh: 再次被污染的设备必须重新消毒。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次/重新”。因此 recontaminate = contaminate（污染）+ re-（再次）。这个词常见于食品安全、医疗消毒、实验室操作、环境工程等语境，强调“本来已清洁/已达标，但又被污染回去”。

summary.en: “Recontaminates” means “contaminates again” or “becomes contaminated again.”
summary.zh: “recontaminates”表示“再次污染（某物）”或“再次变得被污染”。

definition.en: to contaminate something again after it has been cleaned, treated, or made safe
definition.zh: （在清洁、处理或已变安全之后）再次污染某物

examples.en: If the equipment isn’t stored properly, it recontaminates quickly.
examples.zh: 如果设备没有妥善存放，它很快就会再次被污染。

examples.en: Opening the container without clean gloves can recontaminate the samples.
examples.zh: 不用干净手套打开容器可能会使样本再次受到污染。

definition.en: (of a place, food, water, or a surface) to become contaminated again
definition.zh: （指地点、食物、水或表面）再次变得被污染

examples.en: The water recontaminates when the pipes leak.
examples.zh: 管道漏水时，水会再次被污染。

examples.en: After heavy rain, the beach sometimes recontaminates and closes.
examples.zh: 大雨过后，海滩有时会再次被污染并关闭。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次/重新”。因此 recontaminate = contaminate（污染）+ re-（再次）。
“recontaminates”通常是动词第三人称单数（he/she/it recontaminates），也可作为一般现在时描述规律或事实；对应形式还有 recontaminate（原形）、recontaminated（过去式/过去分词）、recontaminating（进行式）。

summary.en: Recontaminating means contaminating something again after it was cleaned or made safe.
summary.zh: recontaminating 指“在清洁或处理后又再次污染”，常用于“二次污染”的语境。

definition.en: contaminating something again after it has been cleaned, treated, or made safe
definition.zh: 在已经清洁、处理或变得安全之后，又再次把某物污染

examples.en: Touching the sterile tools with bare hands is recontaminating them.
examples.zh: 用裸手碰无菌工具会让它们再次被污染。

examples.en: The leak was fixed, but the water system kept recontaminating.
examples.zh: 漏点修好了，但供水系统仍不断再次受到污染。

examples.en: If staff skip handwashing, they may be recontaminating surfaces in the kitchen.
examples.zh: 如果员工不洗手，就可能在厨房把台面再次弄脏、造成二次污染。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次、重新”。“recontaminate”常用于医疗、食品安全、实验室与环境卫生语境，强调在已消毒/净化之后发生的“二次污染”。
常见搭配：recontaminating surfaces/tools/water supply；prevent recontamination（防止再污染/二次污染）。

summary.en: Recontamination means contamination happening again after something has already been cleaned or treated.
summary.zh: Recontamination 指在已经清洁或处理后又发生的“再次污染”。

definition.en: the act or process of becoming contaminated again after being cleaned or made safe
definition.zh: 在清洁或处理后再次被污染的过程或情况

examples.en: The lab added new filters to prevent recontamination of the samples.
examples.zh: 实验室加装了新过滤器，以防样本再次被污染。

examples.en: Wash your hands after touching raw meat to avoid recontamination.
examples.zh: 接触生肉后要洗手，避免再次污染。

examples.en: After the flood, officials worried about recontamination of the drinking water.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，官员担心饮用水会再次受到污染。

extraExplanation: “recontamination”= re-（再次）+ contamination（污染）。常见于食品安全、医学消毒、实验室操作与环境治理等语境，强调“本来已经清理/消毒过，但又被污染了”。
搭配很常见：prevent/avoid recontamination（防止再次污染）、risk of recontamination（再次污染风险）、recontamination of water/food/surfaces（对水/食物/表面的再次污染）。

summary.en: Recontemplate means to think about something again, usually more deeply or carefully.
summary.zh: recontemplate 指把某事再想一遍，通常更深入、更仔细地重新斟酌。

definition.en: to think about something again, often more carefully or from a new angle
definition.zh: 重新思考；再三斟酌（通常更仔细或换个角度）

examples.en: After reading the feedback, I had to recontemplate my decision.
examples.zh: 看完反馈后，我不得不重新思考我的决定。

examples.en: Let’s recontemplate our plan before we spend any money.
examples.zh: 在花钱之前，我们先再斟酌一下计划。

examples.en: She recontemplated what he said and realized she had misunderstood.
examples.zh: 她重新回想他说的话，才发现自己误会了。

extraExplanation: “recontemplate”由前缀 re-（再次）+ contemplate（沉思；考虑）组成，意思直观：把某件事“再想一遍”。在正式写作中可用，但日常口语里更常说 “think again / reconsider / reflect on it again”。
语气上比 “reconsider” 更强调“沉思、细想”的过程，而不仅是做出不同决定。

summary.en: “Recontemplated” means “reconsidered; thought about again carefully.”
summary.zh: “recontemplated”意为“重新考虑；再次仔细思考”。

definition.en: thought about something again; reconsidered it carefully
definition.zh: 再次思考；重新仔细考虑

examples.en: After reading the feedback, she recontemplated her decision to quit.
examples.zh: 读完反馈后，她重新考虑了辞职的决定。

examples.en: He recontemplated the plan overnight and found a safer option.
examples.zh: 他过了一夜重新思考这个计划，找到了更安全的选择。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再一次”，加在“contemplate（沉思、仔细考虑）”前面，就形成“recontemplate（再思考、重新审视）”。“recontemplated”是其过去式/过去分词形式，属于较少见、偏书面或正式的用法。

summary.en: Recontemplating means thinking about something again, usually in a deeper, more reflective way.
summary.zh: recontemplating 指再次思考某事，通常带有更深入、更反思式的重新斟酌。

definition.en: thinking about something again, often more carefully or from a new angle; reconsidering deeply
definition.zh: 再次思考某事（通常更仔细或换个角度）；重新深思、重新斟酌

examples.en: After the meeting, I’m recontemplating my decision to quit.
examples.zh: 开完会后，我在重新斟酌自己辞职的决定。

examples.en: She spent the evening recontemplating what he said and what it might mean.
examples.zh: 她用整个晚上重新思考他说的话以及可能的含义。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再一次/重新”。“recontemplating”是动词“recontemplate”的现在分词形式，常见于写作中用来表达“再次深思、反复琢磨”，语气比“rethink”更正式、更偏“沉思”。
实际口语里更常用“rethink / reconsider”。“recontemplate”相对少见，适合用在较正式或带有内省、文学色彩的语境。

summary.en: Recontemplation means thinking about something again, usually in a careful, reflective way.
summary.zh: recontemplation 指对某事再次进行更谨慎、更深入的思考。

definition.en: the act of thinking about something again, often more carefully or after getting new information
definition.zh: 重新思考；再三沉思（常指在获得新信息或需要更谨慎判断后再次考虑）

examples.en: After hearing both sides, she asked for time for recontemplation before making a decision.
examples.zh: 听完双方的说法后，她要求一些时间重新思考再做决定。

examples.en: The policy went back for recontemplation when unexpected problems appeared.
examples.zh: 出现意外问题后，这项政策被送回去重新审视。

extraExplanation: “recontemplation”由前缀 re-（再次）+ contemplation（沉思、深思）构成，意思很直观，但在日常英语里相对少见。更常用的替代说法有：reconsideration（重新考虑，最常用）、rethinking（重新思考，更口语）、review（复审/回顾，偏流程）或 second thought(s)（改主意/再想想）。
语气与场景：contemplation 带有“沉思、深入思索”的感觉，因此 recontemplation 往往比 reconsideration 更“郑重/深沉”，适合正式写作、学术或政策讨论语境。

summary.en: A rare verb meaning to contend or compete again.
summary.zh: 一个很少用的动词，表示“再次争辩或再次竞争”。

definition.en: (Rare) To contend again; to dispute or compete again after a previous argument or contest.
definition.zh: （罕见）再次争辩；在先前争论或竞赛之后再次争夺/竞争。

examples.en: After the first debate, the candidates recontended on the same issue a week later.
examples.zh: 第一次辩论之后，候选人一周后就同一议题再次交锋。

examples.en: The two teams will recontend for the title next season.
examples.zh: 两支队伍下赛季将再次争夺冠军。

extraExplanation: “recontend”在现代英语中非常少见，阅读或写作时更常用的是“contend again / compete again / dispute again”等表达。
如果你想写的是“recommend”（推荐），那是一个非常常用的词，拼写为 r-e-c-o-m-m-e-n-d。可以告诉我你的原句，我可以帮你确认正确用词。

summary.en: “Reconter” is not standard modern English; it usually refers to “recount” (to tell or describe events again).
summary.zh: “reconter”不是现代标准英语拼写；通常指“recount”（复述/讲述经过）。

definition.en: (Nonstandard/rare in modern English) to tell a story or describe events again; same meaning as “recount.”
definition.zh: （非标准/现代英语中很少用）复述；讲述（经历或事件）；相当于“recount”。

examples.en: He recontered the events of the trip to his friends.
examples.zh: 他向朋友们复述了旅行中的经历。

examples.en: The witness recontered what she saw that night.
examples.zh: 目击者复述了她那晚看到的事情。

extraExplanation: “reconter”不是现代标准英语里常用的拼写。你大概率想写的是 **recount**（复述、讲述经过）。
也有人会把它和 **encounter**（遇到）混淆；如果你的意思是“遇见/偶遇”，更常用的是 encounter。
如果你是在读较老的文本或受法语影响：法语 **raconter** 是“讲述”，**rencontrer** 是“遇见”，它们都可能导致写出类似“reconter”的拼写。

summary.en: Recontest means to contest something again—run again for a position or challenge a decision/result again.
summary.zh: Recontest 指“再次争夺或再次提出质疑”，如再次参选或再次挑战某个决定/结果。

definition.en: to compete for, challenge, or dispute something again (for example, an election result, a claim, a decision, or a title).
definition.zh: 再次就某事进行竞争、质疑或争夺（例如再次挑战选举结果、主张、决定或头衔）。

examples.en: The candidate decided to recontest the seat in the next election.
examples.zh: 这位候选人决定在下次选举中再次竞逐这个席位。

examples.en: The team will recontest the championship after last year’s loss.
examples.zh: 球队将在去年失利后再次冲击冠军。

examples.en: They tried to recontest the ruling, but the court refused to reopen the case.
examples.zh: 他们试图再次质疑该裁决，但法院拒绝重启案件。

extraExplanation: “recontest”属于较少见、较正式的用法，常见于新闻报道或法律/政治语境中（如选举、裁决、索赔等）。日常口语里更常用“contest again / challenge again / run again”。
在英式政治新闻里，recontest 常指“在下一次选举中再次参选同一席位”；在法律语境里可指“再次提出异议/再度争议某项决定”。

summary.en: Recontested means competed for again, especially in an election or political race.
summary.zh: Recontested 指“再次竞争/再次争夺”，尤指在选举中再次参选或再度对决。

definition.en: past tense / past participle of recontest; to contest (an election, seat, decision, etc.) again after a previous contest.
definition.zh: recontest 的过去式/过去分词；（对选举席位、决定等）再次提出竞争、再次争夺、再次挑战。

examples.en: She recontested her seat in the next election and won.
examples.zh: 她在下一次选举中再次竞选该席位并获胜。

examples.en: The party recontested the district after losing it four years earlier.
examples.zh: 该党在四年前失利后又再次争夺这个选区。

definition.en: having been contested again; used as an adjective, especially in political contexts (a “recontested seat/race”).
definition.zh: （尤用于政治语境）被再次争夺的；再次出现竞争的（如“再次争夺的席位/选战”）。

examples.en: It was a recontested race with the same two candidates.
examples.zh: 这是一场再次对决的选战，还是那两位候选人。

examples.en: The recontested seat drew national attention.
examples.zh: 这个再次争夺的席位引起了全国关注。

extraExplanation: “recontest”常见于英式英语的政治新闻（如英国议会选区、地方选举），指同一人或同一政党在下一次选举中“再次参选/再战”。美式英语里也能理解，但更常见的表达有“run again”或“seek reelection（寻求连任）”。

summary.en: Recontesting means competing or challenging again, often used for running again in an election or disputing a decision again.
summary.zh: recontesting 指“再次竞争或再次挑战”，常用于“再次参选”或“对决定/结果再度提出异议”。

definition.en: (present participle of recontest) to compete for something again, especially to run again in an election or to challenge a decision again.
definition.zh: （recontest 的现在分词）再次竞争某事物，尤指再次参选，或对某项决定/结果再次提出异议、再度争夺。

examples.en: She is recontesting her seat in the next election.
examples.zh: 她将在下一次选举中再次竞选自己的席位。

examples.en: The company is recontesting the fine in court.
examples.zh: 这家公司正在法院里再次对罚款提出异议。

definition.en: the act or process of competing or challenging again (used mainly in formal writing).
definition.zh: 再次竞争或再次争辩/挑战的行为或过程（多见于较正式的写作）。

examples.en: Recontesting the result may take months.
examples.zh: 重新争夺（或再次质疑）该结果可能需要数月。

extraExplanation: “recontesting”常见于政治与法律语境：政治上多指“再次参选/再度争夺席位”，法律上可指“再次提出争议、重新挑战裁决或处罚”。
拼写上可拆为 re-（再、重新）+ contest（竞争/争辩）。在英式新闻里常见“recontest a seat”（再次竞选某席位）。

summary.en: Recontest means to compete or challenge again, often used for running again in an election.
summary.zh: Recontest 指“再次竞争或提出争议”，常用于表示“再次参选/再度角逐选举”。

definition.en: to compete for something again (especially an election) after having competed before
definition.zh: 再次角逐、再度参选（尤指曾经参选过的选举）

examples.en: After losing last year, she decided to recontest the seat in the next election.
examples.zh: 去年落选后，她决定在下一次选举中再次角逐该席位。

examples.en: The party may recontest the district if it can find a stronger candidate.
examples.zh: 如果能找到更强的候选人，该政党可能会再次争夺这个选区。

definition.en: to challenge or dispute something again (such as a decision, result, or claim)
definition.zh: 再次提出异议、再次争议（如对决定、结果或主张）

examples.en: The company tried to recontest the ruling, but the court refused.
examples.zh: 公司试图再次对裁决提出异议，但法院拒绝了。

examples.en: He recontested the test score after reviewing the grading.
examples.zh: 他在查看评分后再次对考试分数提出了异议。

extraExplanation: “recontest”由前缀 re-（再次）+ contest（竞争/争议）组成，常见于英联邦英语的新闻语境，尤其谈到候选人“再次参选”某个席位（seat）或“再次竞选”某个选区（district/constituency）。
你输入的“recontests”通常是第三人称单数（He/She recontests...）或名词复数（较少见）。更常用的基本词形是 “recontest”。

summary.en: Recontinuance means starting to continue again after a pause; a renewal or resumption (formal and rare).
summary.zh: recontinuance 指中断后再次继续，即恢复、重新开始持续（正式且较罕见）。

definition.en: the act of continuing again after a stop; a renewal or resumption of something
definition.zh: （中断后）再次继续；恢复；重新开始持续

examples.en: After the strike ended, the recontinuance of normal services took a few days.
examples.zh: 罢工结束后，正常服务的恢复又花了几天时间。

examples.en: They discussed the recontinuance of negotiations next month.
examples.zh: 他们讨论了下个月恢复谈判的事。

definition.en: (formal, rare) a renewed period of continuing; continued existence again
definition.zh: （正式用语，罕见）再次持续的一段时期；重新延续的状态

examples.en: Funding was approved, ensuring the recontinuance of the program.
examples.zh: 资金获批，确保了该项目的继续开展。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，现代英语里更常用 resumption（恢复/重新开始）、continuation（继续）、renewal（重启/续期）。在法律或非常正式的语境中，偶尔会看到 recontinuance，用来强调“中断后又继续”。
构词上是 re-（再次）+ continuance（持续、继续），意思直观，但因为有更常用的同义词，所以不常出现在日常表达里。

summary.en: “Recontinue” means to continue again after a pause (resume). It is uncommon in everyday English.
summary.zh: “recontinue”指“暂停后再次继续（恢复进行）”，日常英语中较少用。

definition.en: to continue again after stopping; to resume. (Example: After a short break, the meeting was recontinued. / We will recontinue our discussion tomorrow.)
definition.zh: （中断后）再次继续；恢复进行。 (例：短暂休息后，会议重新继续进行。/ 我们明天将重新继续讨论。)

examples.en: After lunch, the class recontinued with a quiz.
examples.zh: 午饭后，课程继续进行，并安排了一个小测验。

examples.en: The judge ordered the hearing to be recontinued next week.
examples.zh: 法官命令听证会下周继续进行。

extraExplanation: “recontinue”在现代英语中比较少见，很多情况下更常用“resume”“continue again”“restart”。
在较正式或法律/会议记录等语境里偶尔会看到，用来表示“中断后恢复进行”。

summary.en: Recontract means to sign a contract again (often with new terms), or more generally to contract again.
summary.zh: recontract 指“重新签订合同（常含条款变更）”，也可泛指“再次收缩/变紧”。

definition.en: to make or sign a new contract again, often with changed terms (for a job, service, or deal)
definition.zh: 重新签订合同；再度订约（常指在条款有所调整后对工作、服务或交易重新签约）

examples.en: After the first year, the company decided to recontract the workers with higher pay.
examples.zh: 第一年结束后，公司决定以更高的工资与工人重新签约。

examples.en: We may recontract with the supplier if they can guarantee faster delivery.
examples.zh: 如果供应商能保证更快交货，我们可能会与他们重新签约。

definition.en: (more general) to contract again; to become smaller or tighter again
definition.zh: （更一般）再次收缩；再次变紧

examples.en: When the room cooled down, the metal recontracted slightly.
examples.zh: 房间降温后，金属又轻微收缩了。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次/重新”，加在 contract（签约；收缩）前面就形成 recontract（重新签约；再次收缩）。在日常英语里，更常见的说法是 re-sign a contract（重新签合同）或 renegotiate and sign a new contract（重新谈判并签新合同）。注意 recontract 的重音通常在第二部分：re-CON-tract。

summary.en: Recontracted means “contracted again” (often about muscles/tissues) or “signed/arranged under a new contract again.”
summary.zh: recontracted 表示“再次收缩（常指肌肉/组织）”或“重新签约/续签（合同意义）”。

definition.en: (of a muscle, tissue, or body part) contracted again after relaxing or being stretched.
definition.zh: （肌肉、组织或身体部位）再次收缩；重新挛缩。

examples.en: After the stretch, the muscle quickly recontracted.
examples.zh: 拉伸后，那块肌肉很快又重新收缩了。

examples.en: The therapist noted that the patient’s fingers had recontracted overnight.
examples.zh: 治疗师指出，病人的手指在一夜之间又出现了再次挛缩。

definition.en: made a new contract again; hired or arranged again under a renewed contract.
definition.zh: （合同/雇用/安排）重新签约；再次以合同形式约定。

examples.en: The vendor was recontracted for another year.
examples.zh: 该供应商又续签了一年合同。

examples.en: They recontracted the project after the first agreement expired.
examples.zh: 第一份协议到期后，他们为该项目重新签了合同。

definition.en: describing someone or something that has been contracted again or rehired under a new contract.
definition.zh: （形容词）指已重新签约的；续约的。

examples.en: The recontracted staff will start work on Monday.
examples.zh: 续约后的员工将于周一开始工作。

examples.en: We reviewed the recontracted agreement for any changes.
examples.zh: 我们审阅了重新签订的协议，查看有哪些改动。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次、重新”。因此 recontracted 可以理解为“contracted again（又收缩了）”或“contracted again in a legal sense（又签了一次合同）”。
在日常英语里，合同语境更常见的说法是 renewed / extended the contract（续约/延长合同）或 re-signed（重新签署）。recontracted 更常见于较正式的商务/法律写作或技术说明中。

summary.en: Recontracting means signing a contract again or making a new contract, usually with updated terms.
summary.zh: Recontracting 指再次签合同或重新订约，通常会更新条款。

definition.en: the process of making a new contract again (often after an old contract ends or needs to be changed)
definition.zh: 重新订约；再签合同（常指旧合同到期或需要调整后再签）

examples.en: The company is recontracting its suppliers for next year.
examples.zh: 这家公司正在为明年与供应商重新签约。

examples.en: Recontracting can take weeks because both sides need to review the terms.
examples.zh: 重新签约可能要花好几周，因为双方都需要审查条款。

definition.en: present participle of recontract: to sign a new contract again or to contract again
definition.zh: recontract 的现在分词：再次签订合同；重新订约

examples.en: They are recontracting with the same vendor but at a lower price.
examples.zh: 他们正在与同一家供应商重新签约，但价格更低。

examples.en: If the project scope changes, we may be recontracting to update the agreement.
examples.zh: 如果项目范围有变化，我们可能需要重新签约来更新协议。

extraExplanation: “recontracting”在商务和政府采购语境里很常见，通常指合同到期后的续签/重新招标后的再签，或因价格、服务范围（scope）、合规要求变化而重新谈判条款。日常英语里更常用的说法是 “renewing a contract”（续约）或 “signing a new contract”（签新合同），而 “recontracting”更偏正式、偏行业用语。

summary.en: Recontraction means a second (renewed) contraction, used in physiology/medicine and sometimes in linguistics for renewed shortening of a form.
summary.zh: Recontraction 指“再次收缩”，常用于生理/医学语境；有时也用于语言学，指词形或读音的再次缩合。

definition.en: the act or process of contracting again; a second contraction after something has expanded or relaxed
definition.zh: 再次收缩；在扩张或放松之后发生的第二次收缩过程

examples.en: After the muscle relaxed, recontraction helped stabilize the joint.
examples.zh: 肌肉放松后，再次收缩有助于稳定关节。

examples.en: The therapist taught him to control recontraction during breathing exercises.
examples.zh: 治疗师教他在呼吸练习中控制再次收缩。

definition.en: (linguistics) a renewed shortening or tightening of a word form, often after an earlier change in pronunciation or spelling
definition.zh: （语言学）词形的再次缩合/重新紧缩；常指在较早的读音或拼写变化之后又出现的进一步缩短

examples.en: In casual speech, some forms show recontraction over time.
examples.zh: 在随意口语中，一些形式会随着时间出现再次缩合。

examples.en: The article discusses recontraction in fast, informal pronunciation.
examples.zh: 这篇文章讨论了快速、非正式发音中的再次缩合现象。

extraExplanation: “re-”表示“再次”，“contraction”表示“收缩/缩约”，所以 recontraction 字面就是“再一次的收缩”。它不是日常高频词，更常见于医学/生理（如肌肉、子宫等的再次收缩）或语言学讨论（语音或词形进一步缩短）。
不要和英语里的缩略形式 contraction（如 do not → don’t）混为一谈：那种更常用的说法是 “contraction/contracted form”。recontraction 强调“已经发生过一次变化/收缩之后，又再发生一次”。

summary.en: “recontracts” means “contracts again” or “signs/makes a contract again,” and it can also mean “shrinks/tightens again” (especially in medical contexts).
summary.zh: “recontracts”表示“再次（重新）签订合同”，也可表示“再次收缩/紧缩”（尤用于医学语境）。

definition.en: (third-person singular of recontract) to make a new contract again, or to sign a contract again after changes.
definition.zh: （recontract 的第三人称单数）重新签订合同；在修改后再次订立合同。

examples.en: After the budget changed, the company recontracts with the supplier for a lower price.
examples.zh: 预算变化后，公司与供应商重新签约以获得更低的价格。

examples.en: If the terms are not acceptable, the parties recontract with new conditions.
examples.zh: 如果条款不可接受，双方会在新条件下重新订立合同。

definition.en: to become contracted again; to shrink or tighten again (often used about muscles or tissue in medical writing).
definition.zh: 再次收缩；再次紧缩（常见于医学语境，如肌肉或组织）。

examples.en: When the stimulus returns, the muscle recontracts quickly.
examples.zh: 当刺激再次出现时，肌肉会迅速再次收缩。

examples.en: In some cases, scar tissue recontracts over time.
examples.zh: 在某些情况下，瘢痕组织会随着时间再次收缩。

extraExplanation: “recontracts”通常来自动词“recontract”（re- + contract），意思是“再次/重新……”。在日常英语中更常见的说法是“renegotiate a contract（重新谈判合同）”“sign a new contract（签新合同）”或“re-sign（重新签署）”。
法律/商务语境中可用于强调“重新订立合同”，但在口语里不算常用；医学/生理语境中则用于描述组织或肌肉“再次收缩”。

summary.en: “Recontrast” means to contrast again—re-examining differences under a new or updated perspective.
summary.zh: “recontrast”表示“再次对比/重新对照”，强调在新的或更新的视角下重新凸显差异。

definition.en: to compare things again in order to show differences more clearly; to make a new contrast after a change in situation, data, or viewpoint
definition.zh: （在情况、数据或观点变化后）再次对比，以更清楚地凸显差异；重新形成对照

examples.en: After the second interview, the researcher recontrasted the candidates’ answers.
examples.zh: 第二次访谈后，研究人员又重新对比了候选人的回答。

examples.en: The film recontrasts childhood memories with adult reality.
examples.zh: 这部电影重新对照了童年记忆与成年现实。

extraExplanation: “recontrast”不是日常高频词，更常见的表达是“contrast again / recompare / draw a new contrast”。它偶尔出现在学术写作（如文学批评、数据分析）中，用来强调“在新的材料或框架下再做一次对照”。
拼写上有时会看到带连字符的“re-contrast”，用来更直观地表示“再一次对比”。

summary.en: Recontribute means to contribute again after you have already contributed once.
summary.zh: Recontribute 指在已经贡献过一次之后“再次贡献/再次捐助”。

definition.en: to contribute again; to make another contribution (money, effort, ideas, etc.) after having contributed before
definition.zh: 再次捐助/出力/投稿；在之前已贡献过之后再做一次贡献（如钱、精力、想法等）

examples.en: Past donors are invited to recontribute to support this year’s scholarship fund.
examples.zh: 我们邀请往年的捐赠者再次捐助，以支持今年的奖学金基金。

examples.en: If you can recontribute even a small amount, it will help the project continue.
examples.zh: 如果你能再次捐出哪怕一小笔钱，也能帮助项目继续进行。

examples.en: Several team members recontributed ideas after reading the updated plan.
examples.zh: 几位团队成员在阅读更新后的计划后，又补充贡献了新的想法。

extraExplanation: “recontribute”在日常英语中不算常见，很多时候母语者会更自然地说：contribute again / make another contribution / contribute more。
常见使用场景包括筹款邮件、会员续费提醒、或强调“再次支持/再次捐助”的正式通知语境。

summary.en: Recontribution is a rare noun meaning an additional/repeated contribution, or more formally a repayment/return.
summary.zh: recontribution 是一个较少见的名词，指再次/追加的贡献或捐献；更正式时也可指回报、偿还。

definition.en: an additional or repeated contribution; a contribution made again (often after an earlier one).
definition.zh: 再次（追加）捐献；重复进行的贡献（通常指在之前已经捐过或贡献过之后再次提供）。

examples.en: After the earthquake, many families made a recontribution to the relief fund a month later.
examples.zh: 地震之后，许多家庭在一个月后又向救灾基金追加捐款。

examples.en: The club asked members for a small recontribution to cover rising costs.
examples.zh: 俱乐部请会员再补交一小笔费用以应对成本上涨。

definition.en: (rare, formal) repayment or return for what was given or done; a giving back.
definition.zh: （罕见、较正式）回报；偿还；对所给予或所做之事的回馈。

examples.en: He viewed kindness as something that deserved recontribution.
examples.zh: 他认为善意是值得回报的。

extraExplanation: “recontribution”在现代英语里非常少见，写作和日常交流中更常见的是“contribution（贡献/捐款）”或“additional contribution（追加捐款）”。
很多学习者会把它和“retribution（报应；惩罚性的报复）”混淆：retribution偏“惩罚/报应”，而recontribution（若使用）偏“再次贡献/回馈”。

summary.en: Recontrivance means making a new plan or device by redesigning or thinking again (a rare word).
summary.zh: recontrivance 指“重新构想/重新设计而产生的新方案或装置”，但属于非常少见的词。

definition.en: a new plan, device, or method made by rethinking or redesigning something; the act of contriving again
definition.zh: 重新构想或重新设计出来的新方案/装置/方法；再次筹划、再次想出办法的行为

examples.en: After the first prototype failed, the team started a recontrivance of the design.
examples.zh: 第一个原型失败后，团队开始对设计进行重新构想。

examples.en: The recontrivance of the schedule helped everyone meet the deadline.
examples.zh: 对日程的重新安排帮助大家赶上了截止日期。

extraExplanation: 这个词非常少见，多数现代英语写作不会用；通常会用更常见的表达，如 redesign（重新设计）, rework（返工/重做）, rethink（重新思考）, new plan（新方案）。
构词上可理解为 re-（再次）+ contrivance（巧妙的设计/安排；想出来的办法）。因此读到它时可以按“再造一个办法/再设计一次”的意思去理解。

summary.en: Recontrive means to devise or plan again, often by reworking an earlier idea.
summary.zh: recontrive 指“重新构思/重新筹划”，常表示在原有想法基础上改动后再想一次。

definition.en: to plan, invent, or create again; to devise something anew (often after revising an earlier version)
definition.zh: 重新构思；再度设计或发明（常指在原有方案上修改后重新想出）

examples.en: After the test failed, the engineers had to recontrive the design from scratch.
examples.zh: 测试失败后，工程师们不得不从头重新构思这个设计。

examples.en: She recontrived the plot so the ending felt more believable.
examples.zh: 她重新构思了情节，让结尾更可信。

definition.en: to arrange or manage again in a clever way; to rework a plan or method
definition.zh: 再次巧妙安排或筹划；对计划/方法进行重新调整

examples.en: The team recontrived their schedule to meet the deadline.
examples.zh: 团队重新安排了日程，以赶上截止日期。

extraExplanation: “recontrive”比较少见，更多情况下英语会用“redesign / rethink / rework / devise again / reconceive”。不过它的构词很直观：re-（再一次）+ contrive（巧妙构思、设法做成）。
它常带有“原来想法不够好/行不通，所以需要重新想一个更巧的办法”的语感。

summary.en: Recontrol means to control something again, often after losing control, or to re-adjust a system’s control settings.
summary.zh: recontrol 指“重新控制”，常用于失控后再次掌控，或指对系统控制进行重新调节。

definition.en: to control something again, especially after losing control of it
definition.zh: 重新控制（尤指曾经失去控制后再次掌控）

examples.en: The pilot managed to recontrol the plane after the turbulence.
examples.zh: 飞行员在遭遇强气流后设法重新控制了飞机。

examples.en: The company is trying to recontrol costs by cutting unnecessary spending.
examples.zh: 公司正试图通过削减不必要的开支来重新控制成本。

definition.en: to regulate or adjust a system again so it behaves correctly
definition.zh: 再次调节/再控制（使系统恢复到正常运行状态）

examples.en: After updating the software, the technician had to recontrol the temperature settings.
examples.zh: 更新软件后，技术员需要重新调节温度设置。

extraExplanation: “recontrol”在日常英语中不算常见；更多时候人们会写成“re-control”（带连字符）或直接说“regain control (of...) / take back control (of...)”。在技术语境（如控制系统、工程）里，“recontrol”更可能出现，表示对系统进行再次控制/重新调参。

summary.en: Recontrolling means controlling something again or taking back control.
summary.zh: Recontrolling 指再次控制或重新掌控。

definition.en: (Present participle of recontrol) controlling something again; taking back control after losing it, or adjusting control once more.
definition.zh: （recontrol 的现在分词）再次控制；在失去控制后重新掌控，或再一次进行控制/调控。

examples.en: The company is recontrolling costs after a year of overspending.
examples.zh: 公司在超支一年后，正在重新控制成本。

examples.en: After the spill, the team focused on recontrolling the flow of water.
examples.zh: 泄漏之后，团队把重点放在重新控制水流上。

examples.en: The software update is recontrolling how the device manages power.
examples.zh: 这次软件更新正在重新调控设备的电源管理方式。

extraExplanation: “re-”是常见前缀，表示“再次、重新”。因此 recontrol 强调“把控制权拿回来”或“重新进行控制设置”。
在日常英语里，人们更常说“regain control / take control again / get things under control”。“recontrol / recontrolling”在工程、管理、技术语境中更常见一些。

summary.en: Reconvalesce means to recover gradually after an illness, injury, or operation.
summary.zh: Reconvalesce 指（病后、伤后或手术后）逐步康复、恢复体力。

definition.en: to recover health and strength gradually after an illness, injury, or operation
definition.zh: （病后、伤后或手术后）逐渐康复、恢复体力

examples.en: She stayed with her parents for two weeks to reconvalesce after surgery.
examples.zh: 她手术后在父母家住了两周来休养康复。

examples.en: He is reconvalescing at home and hopes to return to work next month.
examples.zh: 他正在家中康复休养，希望下个月回去上班。

extraExplanation: “reconvalesce”语气偏正式，常见于医疗、新闻报道或书面语；日常口语里更常用“recover”“get better”“rest and recover”。
词源上与“convalescent（康复中的）”“convalescence（康复期）”同源，常用来强调“需要一段时间慢慢恢复”，而不只是“好了”。

summary.en: Reconvalescence means the time and process of recovering strength and health after illness or injury.
summary.zh: Reconvalescence 指病后或伤后恢复健康与体力的过程与时期（恢复期、康复）。

definition.en: Recovery of health and strength after an illness, injury, or medical treatment; the period when someone is getting better.
definition.zh: （病后、伤后或治疗后）康复；恢复期。

examples.en: After the surgery, she spent two weeks in reconvalescence at home.
examples.zh: 手术后，她在家休养康复了两周。

examples.en: During his reconvalescence, he started taking short walks every day.
examples.zh: 在康复期间，他每天开始进行短距离散步。

examples.en: The doctor recommended plenty of rest during reconvalescence.
examples.zh: 医生建议在恢复期要充分休息。

extraExplanation: 词源提示：reconvalescence 来自拉丁语词根，核心含义是“重新变得强壮/健康”。常见搭配有 during reconvalescence（在康复期间）、a period of reconvalescence（一个恢复期）、convalescent（adj./n. 康复中的；康复者）。
语体与语境：这是较正式的词，常见于医疗、新闻或书面表达；日常口语里更常说 recovery 或 getting better。

summary.en: “Reconvalescent” describes someone (or a patient) who is in the period of recovery after illness, injury, or surgery.
summary.zh: “Reconvalescent”指病后、伤后或术后处于恢复期的（人/病人），强调正在逐渐恢复健康与体力。

definition.en: Recovering health and strength after an illness, injury, or medical treatment.
definition.zh: （病后/伤后/手术后）正在康复中的，处于恢复期的。

examples.en: She is still convalescent after the operation, so she needs plenty of rest.
examples.zh: 她手术后仍在康复期，所以需要充足的休息。

examples.en: The hospital has a quiet ward for convalescent patients.
examples.zh: 医院有一个安静的病房专门给康复期的病人。

definition.en: A person who is recovering from an illness or injury.
definition.zh: 康复者；正在恢复健康的人（病后/伤后）。

examples.en: The convalescent was advised to avoid heavy exercise for a few weeks.
examples.zh: 医生建议这位康复者在几周内避免剧烈运动。

examples.en: Volunteers brought books and warm meals to convalescents.
examples.zh: 志愿者给康复者送去了书和热饭。

extraExplanation: 词源上来自拉丁语 convalescere，意为“重新变得强壮”。因此它强调的是“逐渐恢复体力/健康”的过程，而不只是“感觉好一点”。
常见搭配：convalescent home（疗养院/康复护理机构），convalescent leave（病后康复假），convalescent care（康复护理）。
近义词辨析：recovering 更口语、更广；convalescent 更书面、常用于医疗或正式语境。

summary.en: Reconvene means to meet again after a break, or to call a group together again for another meeting.
summary.zh: Reconvene 指休息后再次开会/重新集合，或重新召集一群人再次开会。

definition.en: (of a group, meeting, or organization) to meet again after a pause or break, often to continue work or discussion.
definition.zh: （团体、会议或组织）在暂停或休息后再次集合/重新开会，通常为了继续工作或讨论。

examples.en: Let’s reconvene after lunch to finish the discussion.
examples.zh: 我们午饭后再开会，把讨论完成。

examples.en: The committee will reconvene next week to vote on the proposal.
examples.zh: 委员会将于下周再次开会，对该提案进行表决。

definition.en: to bring people together again; to organize a group to meet again.
definition.zh: 使（人群）再次集合；重新召集开会。

examples.en: The manager reconvened the team to address the new deadline.
examples.zh: 经理重新召集团队来应对新的截止日期。

examples.en: They reconvened the panel for a final round of questions.
examples.zh: 他们重新召集专家小组进行最后一轮提问。

extraExplanation: “reconvene”由 re-（再次）+ convene（召集、开会）组成，常用于正式或工作场景（会议、委员会、法庭、谈判等）。
常见搭配：reconvene after lunch / at 2 p.m. / next week；reconvene the meeting / the committee / the court。
与近义词区别：resume 强调“继续进行（活动/工作）”；reconvene 强调“人再次集合开会”。会议可以 reconvene，工作也可以 resume。

summary.en: Reconvened means met again or resumed a meeting after a break.
summary.zh: reconvened 指在休会或暂停后再次集合/重新开会。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of reconvene) to meet again after stopping, or to gather again at a later time.
definition.zh: （reconvene 的过去式/过去分词）在暂停之后再次开会；改日再集合。

examples.en: After a short break, the committee reconvened at 2 p.m.
examples.zh: 短暂休会后，委员会在下午两点重新开会。

examples.en: The court reconvened the next morning to hear more testimony.
examples.zh: 法院第二天上午再次开庭以听取更多证词。

examples.en: We reconvened online to finish the discussion.
examples.zh: 我们在网上再次集合以完成讨论。

extraExplanation: “reconvene”由前缀 re-（再次）+ convene（集合、召开）构成，因此“reconvened”常用于正式场景，如会议、法庭、议会等，表示“休会/暂停后再次召开”。在日常口语里也可用更简单的说法，如 “meet again” 或 “get back together”。

summary.en: “Reconvenes” means “meets again,” especially for formal meetings, courts, or assemblies.
summary.zh: “Reconvenes”表示“再次开会/重新集合”，多用于正式场合如会议、法庭或议会。

definition.en: (of a group, meeting, court, or parliament) to meet again after a break or pause.
definition.zh: （团体、会议、法庭或议会）休会/暂停后再次开会、重新召开。

examples.en: The committee reconvenes next Monday to vote on the proposal.
examples.zh: 委员会下周一重新开会，对该提案进行表决。

examples.en: Court reconvenes at 2 p.m. after lunch.
examples.zh: 法庭午休后于下午两点再度开庭。
